Reviews.Title: “A REALLY TERRIFIC VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a family vacation and could not have made a better choice! The location was paradise perfect. Very nice view overlooking the ocean, and just a short stroll to the beach. Our room was positively beautiful. Clean, lovely furnishing, nice in room amenities (small refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and oven, with fully stocked cabinets, air conditioner was in perfect working order), crispy linens, great television and dvd player. Both indoor and outdoor pools were wonderfully kept. as were the hot tubs. Plenty of fresh clean towels. The food was absolutely delicious -- especially the grill out by the pool. MaryLou at the front desk was a dream! In fact, EVERY single staff member was pleasant, helpful and cheerful. We look forward to our return trip. Thank you so very, very much for a fabulous vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cgras777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for our family vacation this summer - it's our 2nd time back to this hotel. We like the beach, outdoor pool and swimup bar, indoor pool and hot tubs. The room was clean, staff friendly - we like it as it is a distance from the Boardwalk which is fun to visit , but we had stayed at another hotel on the boardwalk and it was too busy/noisy for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WALPOLE401
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is an oceanfront resort hotel but not fancy. It is family friendly and also has some nice amenities. The Reflections Restaurant within the hotel is very good and has an early bird menu from 5 PM to 7 PM with great selections. The hotel also has regular dining for lunch, breakfast and dinner if you like. The hotel is getting a bit old and the rooms could use a bit of refreshing. The pool and pool bar are really great and you are only steps from the beach. The rates are comparable and if you want to go off season, the rates are really attractive. I have stayed there every year for the last 8 years and continue to enjoy myself each time!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Greg G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn sept of 2012 . This place was great! Very clean , room was nice. Staff was friendly. Pool area was nice. We tried the restaurant and ate there every day after. We stayed three nights , the third night was $58 dollars cheaper. Made me happy. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: na4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay here. Wanted to book the Hilton but it was full. Basically if you are used to nicer hotels you won't be impressed with this hotel. Upon check in I noticed the sheets had not been changed from the previous guests. Gross and unacceptable, I don't think it's too much to expect clean sheets. Room was ok but didnt smell fresh, bathroom tiny, hallways and elevator so dingy and looked filthy. Pool was small and crowded and not kid friendly because it's centered around a bar. No umbrellas in pool area so it's hard to find shade. Breakfast in hotel just ok not much variety although it's nice that kids eat free. The balconies were nice with a good view and the location is good though not on the boardwalk. The hotel just seems old and run down, next time I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Water views,excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mjmae
Reviews.Content: Expensive king suite on labor day weekend,buyt other than the price all was great. Nice beach, pool great for kids and adults. Kids not allowed on hot tub unless 16.free laundry. Sodas in vending machine 40 cents! Right on boardwalk. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: diane s
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to coincide with dropping off my oldest at college. We had never been to Ocean City or stayed at a Holiday Inn. We were pleasantly surprized. The hotel is not fancy but the location on the beach makes up for the lack of updates. For us with boys 17, 14 and 7 the pools both indoor and out were a nice option and break from the beach. We could hang out on the beach and take a mid afternoon break for lunch (either at the pool or in the room) and then head back to the beach. The beach was really pretty ( I am from Long Island) with clean water and lots of waves. Even for really littles ones who may not swim the high tides would create tidal pools on the beach for them to play in. The pool has a swim up bar and lots of chairs. PS you need to bring your own beach chairs and umbrella for the beach or be prepared to rent for the day. Rooms are pretty basic with two double beds and pull out double sofa. A little cramped for us when the pull out sofabed was open, but doable. Best was the balcony overlooking the beach (have to rent beachfront view for upcharge when hotel full). We had coffee, lunch and wine out there. Rooms have a small kitchenette which really comes in handy for doing breakfast and or lunch in the room. Room was clean and maids attentive. Folks at the front desk where very pleasant and helpful. Only complaint was I asked for a high floor and when we got there they put us on 2. Front desk said they had not record of the request. If you book online you have to call in this request. I did but they never noted. Turned out okay as we were able to call down to some of our kids to hand up boggie boards etc. View was fine but could have been better with a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vibes on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Great service even though we had a tough situation - we had to change rooms as availability for our dates was very limited. The staff seemed to be predominantly Romanian and the people we spoke with were very charming and customer service oriented. We were left waiting when we came to check in for our second night, and for that we were given a complimentary breakfast. Overall the facilities were great, the beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean. Spacious parking out front and the beach was great.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: biggie21
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite vacation spots. Hotel can use a little updating but the amenities are unbelievable. Your away from the boardwalk so the beach is not crowded for day and your only a 5 minute drive from the boardwalk for night. You have an indoor and outdoor pool with a poolside bar and grill. Your also right dab in the middle of coastal highway not far all the great restaurants Ocean City has too offer.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: milliegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few days last week. The staff is wonderful and ready and willing to help with any problem which we had one big problem. But, the hotel is smelly and very outdated. I think that many beachfront hotels have the same type of problems. You pay sooo much money for hotels up there until you expect sometimes more than you get. The pool with swim up bar is great. There is also a snack bar beside the pool. We will not stay there next year. There were some other people we knew that stayed there and felt the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SomeNYCGuy
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. I thought the service, amenities, and price where all above acceptable. The room was a little run-down, but about what I expect for such a busy vacation spot. The restaurant was very reasonable (they had a kids-eat-free offer though we didn't take advantage). The pool, game room, and gym are open late. I think the game room was something like 5AM to midnight. The gym was decent with free weights and machines, I used it several times. An indoor pool with 2 hot tubs, a nice outdoor pool, and very close to the beach. We were far from the boardwalk, but having gone to the boardwalk once I think it's no big deal. Much of the boardwalk is hotels and some cheapo stores, then you get to the fun area around the Jolly Roger At the Pier and other (expensive) activities. We spent one day on the boardwalk, and it was plenty. The staff was very friendly, though we had no major problems to ask assistance on. I was a bit worried about the hotel before booking because of reports of the state of the rooms, and ours was not perfect. But, I was really the only one who noticed and I was just looking for issues. The view was spectacular (7th floor facing ocean) and it seems like most of the rooms would have an excellent view (and if not, opened right out onto the pool or dune). We had fears of drunks sitting in the pool at the swim-up bar, but it was all very family-friendly during our visit. I was woken up once be our neighbors at 3AM, but I am a light sleeper and the soon quited down. It is a busy place. All in all, very happy with the place, and my kids enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jason f
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty god for ocean city. We enjoy coming for long weekends as its not a bad drive. The holiday inn is a great value. There are really 3 nice hotels in ocean city. The Hilton, the Marriott, and the new holiday inn. These three hotels are usually booked and cost much more than this holiday inn. The hotel was clean, the bed was soft and its got great beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Customer Care and Maintenance of Facility”
Reviews.Author: Gordon G
Reviews.Content: Our first night, the bed was way too soft. If I sat on the edge, it sank down alarmingly. The next day, I just casually asked the front desk "when are the mattresses due to be changed out, I think ours is shot" and they replied they replace them every year. I was not actively complaining or looking for a change, but the next thing we knew, they had a new mattress installed on our bed. What really made this visit special was our balcony that overlooked the ocean where my wife and I could drink coffee and watch the dolphins. Sitting there every morning, we observed the maintenance guys doing the morning pool and walkway cleaning, etc. They followed the same, thorough process every time. It was evident that whoever is in charge of daily mainenance has an excellent training and followup program in place. Every day, there was also painting or some other extra maintenance activity going on. We loved the full kitchen and also appreciated the fresh fruit in the lobby. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful I've encountered in many years of travel. This may not be the newest or a "flagship" Holiday Inn, but the care taken by the staff makes it feel that way. We also like the location near Rt.90 - that lets us loop around Ocean City to visit the rest of our family at Frountier Town campground (we give our Motorhome to the kids/grandkids there) and out of the congested mess further south. Parking was good and easy, with very good beach access so we could leave our sand chairs in the car and pick them up on the way out to the beach. The beach is really nice there too. We'll stay there again. Suggestion: I think the box springs on the bed are due to be replaced (room 714). Even with the new mattress, there was a lack of support on the bed. Maybe consider going to a firm foundation with a foam mattress? Foam mattresses have come a long way in the last 10 years. Anyway, thanks for a very pleasant week at Ocean City. Gordon

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: mato1180
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Ocean City last night. This was our 3rd year in a row vacationing there. I was hoping the hotel would be just as nice as the pictures on their website, and luckily it was!!!! The hotel was well kept, although it can use some updating. Their staff was so friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has a lot to do for kids and families. Every day there is something planned for vacationers. (ex: zumba, clown, arts and crafts, cooking with kids, etc) You almost felt like you were at a resort. Music being played all day at the pool, swim up bar, shuffle boards, tennis courts. It was very nice especially on days that the weather wasn't so good. Overall, I was happy with this hotel and would recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: MoeKell
Reviews.Content: The location was good if you want to be on the beach. However it was too far to walk to the boardwalk. The hotel needs a lot of TLC. The carpets are spotted and the rooms need some updating. The shower curtain had mold stains and there were cracks in the shower tiles. The hotel entrance is hidden to the left side with no signs directing you there. We went in through the convention center entrance and walked around for about 10 minutes before we found our way to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It's a fun place and would return”
Reviews.Author: dbldecker
Reviews.Content: We were able to use priority club points to rent two rooms which was great! The view from the south side 5th floor of pool, ocean and tennis courts was very nice. The place was always bustling with life and music. It's also very pretty with palm trees, hammocks, a tiki hut and swim up bar. They also have a nice exercise room. The pool isn't large enough for this size hotel but at off hours you can swim a little. Most people just stand in the water. None of my family of 5 really used the pool. The king bedroom had a lot of problems but the room with the double beds was in good condition. We had a faulty lock that continuously kept us struggling to get into the room but luckily we could get enter in through our adjoining room. Maintenance came twice but we still had trouble. The sliding door to balcony was very difficult to close and the closet doors kept coming off the track. The heat lamp died and the mattress was also very soft. The refrigerator made a high pitched noise which could be temporarily stopped by turning it off. Other room doors opening and closing shook our door. The cooking area and large refrigerator were nice plus there is a small dishwasher. Despite the aging of the facility, we had a great time and would return again. The average rating is due to the price/quality of the king room but ~$300 seems to be typical in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updated”
Reviews.Author: rtp216
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the beach without door pool and indoor pool. The outdoor pool has a swim up bar. At times it can get a little rowdy and not kid friendly. There was a group playing beer pong in the pool. The room has a little kitchen area which was nice to have, but the rooms need a good update.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ~ We Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: golden1212
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay. We had the Eastern Oceanfront room - great view of the ocean as well as the pool area. Room was clean and had lots of space. Kitchen had everything we needed. Balcony also was roomy with table and chairs. My Grandson loved the pools. The sun deck was great. Staff was friendly and helpful. Large parking lot. We had a very relaxing stay with no problems. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Madeline G
Reviews.Content: and this holiday inn is worth every penny. We stayed in a king ocean front room and had a great view of the outside pool/garden area as well as the beach. My boyfriend said his favorite moment of our vacation was when we first walked into the room (we read some bad reviews after booking) and seeing dolphins while on the balcony. The room itself was great! We had a full kitchen stocked with everything from dinnerware to a toaster and electric can opener. We also had a fireplace and a nice flat screen tv. The ammenties the hotel offered were great, the people were friendly, and the food at the outside grill was great. The cost is pricey to stay here but if you're looking for a relaxing and pleasant place to stay its worth it. If we ever return to OC we will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jojan7381
Reviews.Content: The closet thing to being in an island resort.Great pool ,great location and clean!!!Will definetly be back!!!!!Took my 8 year old granddaughter and she loved it.Outdoor pool,indoor pool,game room,comuter room.They also had cooking classe for kids,magic shows and other activities for inclement weather.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn, what happened to you?!”
Reviews.Author: Mcao
Reviews.Content: I thought I found a good hotel for my family's mini trips. We first stayed at this hotel last year and had such a wonderful experience so I decided to come back this year. We stayed here back in May and found it nice. The only minor complaint I had was with the front desk staff. They're not the warmest, most friendly staff. The room we got was not what we would've liked but we made ut work for us as it was a mini trip. Now our last trip which was back in July was one that has/is making me second think my future stay here. Again, the front desk staff, the lady who's name I neglected to capture, was again not the most helpful and sincere person. We asked for a room in one of the top floors but was told that the only room they had available was one on the 3rd floor. We told her that is not high enough for us. We asked her if she had one on the 5th or above and she said no. She then told me that the only other room available was on the 2nd floor. Now, if I'm asking for a room on one of the top floors what in her right mind would think I would even consider a room on the 2nd floor. Then, she proceeded to let us know that the room on the 3rd floor is right across from the ice machine. At that point we were left with really no option but to choose the 3rd floor. Now the one thing she neglected to tell us is that it's a corner room, at the inner nook of the hotel with a very poor view of the ocean. On top of that, when my husband went to check out and requested a hardcopy of the bill, she refused to give him one. I cannot believe that this is acceptable at that hotel. I'm sorry to say but they've just lost this one customer.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed!!!( LONG)”
Reviews.Author: Theresa V
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived on Sunday July 29 at 2 pm and told our room was not ready(1 hour before check in was expected) and they would call us on our cell by 4:30 they still did not call us but the room was in fact ready. We had added an additional day to our trip back in May and we were told we could stay and would not have to move, only to find out they gave our room to someone else and we would have to change to a smoking room. I have 2 children and would never put them in a smoking room, I also have asthma they said nothing they could do so we cancelled the last night. It turned into a blessing in disguise. The room smelled like smoke we had to leave the door open to air it out. The hallways were never clean and smelled like mold. The ocean view was the only good thing I can say about this hotel. I had planned on doing some light cooking but did not want to use anything in the kitchen so we had to eat out which I was trying to avoid with an extremely picky eater and the reason for the kitchen. My coffee maker was broken and after telling the front desk twice I had to leave my room every morning for my coffee. The pools were very dirty and I cringed everytime my children wanted to swim, but had to say yes because the ocean was very rough , I chose this hotel the indoor and outdoor pool. The swim up bar was almost impossible to use because of the drunks that were apparently glued to the seats. I would have left the minute we checked in but the other hotels were booked(believe me I checked every one) and I drove 5 1/2 hours to get there. I know it is not a five star hotel but we paid alot for the room and I expected so much more. I will never stay at a Holiday Inn again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: bigmook
Reviews.Content: room was sufficient. Hotel was clean and friendly. Pool/beach area was like an island resort. Not very kid friendly but ours did just fine. Quick trek to actual beach but not much need to go. Hotel has pool with swim up bar, plenty of lounge chairs and hammocks in the sand. Food and drink prices were reasonable. This is not a five star resort but its one if the nicer hotels in ocean city. For the area it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms & nice staff”
Reviews.Author: familyfun48
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property over the 4th of July. We normally stay at the Holiday on 17th; however, we decided to split the trip between the two hotels to check this one out. The staff is very friendly, and the housekeeping service of Fatina was awesome. So why the average rating? Pros: 1) beautiful beach 2) good indoor pool facilities 3) kitchenette 4) called for broken shower head before dinner & it was fixed upon our return Cons: 1) direct oceanfront rooms are far from elevator 2) The outdoor pool was very nice, but we were uncomfortable after the bar opened. We have 2 children 7 and 9, and while they see their dad drink a beer or myself have a cocktail with dinner, they do not see us sitting at the swim up pool bar at 10:50am (opened at 11am) and not leaving the seat until the bar closes. The first night we were there we watched 3 men (older...at least late 60's early 70's) assissted out of the pool becuase they were so drunk they couldn't stand. We gave it another try the following day. Nope, this time a younger adult ran the length of the bar and jumped in pool. Please realize the pool bar is in the shallow end of the pool. You know the place where your kids may want to swim. Anyway if you're into that kind of thing, this is your place. If you like to have a responsible drink with your dinner, leave by 11am. 3) If you enjoy staying on the boards, this is not for you. 4) While the management made efforts to have family fun activies, the level of drinking made me uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay...”
Reviews.Author: MzLola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much older and the pool is smaller than it looks in the pictures. The service was great and all the staff were very nice! The beach is RIGHT outside of the hotel. Makes it convenient if u have small kids. Bed Bugs were a major concern for me but I checked the matress and didnt see a reason for alarm but still took extra precautions. The room was cleaned daily but was still a little dirty. Bring Lysol!

Reviews.Title: “NOISY!!! Not a great place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Mom_of_3_Wife_of_1
Reviews.Content: After arriving, we hit the beach and pool, which is not very family friendly, since it is centered around a bar. We encountered one drunk guest who was yelling at some teenagers (for no reason), and then encountered the same guest at the pool bar the next day. It appears she is a regular since we overheard her say that she is a frequent and long-term guest. The night we stayed, we arrived back from the rides at 11pm and was greeted with our neighbors who were loud and partied (with children) until 2am. I called the front desk every hour on the hour and they responded but shortly after the partying would resume. I am not sure how many warnings a guest gets before they are booted. I understand that we are in a hotel, but common sense seemed to lack. When I went down to check out I mentioned the neighbors and the staff apologized, but no sort of monetary refund was mentioned. Based on the guests that we encountered, I wouldn't return with my young family again.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAGL-92460
Reviews.Content: OK..just got back from 4 days in this hotel on a family vacation and promised myself that I would provide an honest review, as some of the other posts helped me make my decision. So, here goes...Upon arrival, the hotel seemed fine. We were taken care of right away at the front desk and went right up to the room. Well, the hotel is older, but that's no excuse for dirty common areas. I understand that this is a "beach front" hotel, and guest trail in sand, etc., but the hallways were filthy, the windows seemed like they had not been cleaned in years. My kids were ready to jump ship when they saw the place. There was a huge dust ball that I watched for the 5 days in the corner of the wall when you get off the elevator and it never moved. There was also so much sand on the carpet in the hallways and that too was never addressed-never vacuumed.. The glass elevator looked as iff someone smeared vaseline on the windows. HOWEVER, on the bright side, our room, while older, was clean and had a great set up. I was redeemed when the family saw the room with full kitchen, big beds, fireplace and flat screen tv. We also had a balcony with a wonderful view of the ocean. Luckily, I brought my own febreeze and lysol to kill the musty odor. It was incredibly humid the week we were there so that only made it worse. I went out and bought one of those wax air freshners which did the trick. At least, we had a clean and fresh-smelling environment once we got into our room. The cleaning staff was excellent and kept the place spotless. I even asked that they vacuum the sofa as the previous guests left a bucket of sand on and between the cushions, and they did it with no problem. They would even come around at the end of the day and ask if you needed more bath or kitchen towels. You could not beat the proximity to the beach. We were just steps away with lifeguards and bathrooms and the outdoor grill. The pool was nice, but smaller than it looked in the photos. The location of the hotel on the strip was also good. A grocery store and tons of resturants within walking distance. Ocean City itself was too commercialized for my tastes and I wished I had gone a few miles north to Bethany Beach in DE. So, would I recommend this hotel to others? Depends on your expectations and druthers. We will probably not return to Ocean City, as there are just too many other nicer areas on the east coast. You can take my comments with a grain of salt, or should I say sand, if you really like the area. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “family rooms oc”
Reviews.Author: Autumnblazing
Reviews.Content: We arrived late , they did not give us rooms next to each other, but next morning we got 1 room moved to right next door.Staff was always kind. Helped with what ever we needed . We made use of both pools and beach, very glad for the indoor pool when it rained. Swam there till midnight one night. Game room and free coffee was great, gave us plenty of towels and pillows too ! Sofa beds not too bad; over all we all enjoyed our family time. Our patio faced side of the pool,our rooms were quite when sliding doors were shut . Rooms 104 ,105. Nine people enjoyed the hotel;.aged 5 to 64 !

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mbeener
Reviews.Content: This is the least family friendly facility I have ever stayed in. Room was not cleaned, entire facility dated. Lots of parties and noise on surrounding balconies and in the pool areas. I was stopped by hotel staff while getting in the pool with my four children and yelled at for not having wristbands (never mentioned at check in). We transferred after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great oceanfront location”
Reviews.Author: Sirena1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT near the famed Ocean City boardwalk, in fact it's 40+ blocks away from the end of the boardwalk. However, it is located right on the beach with a pool and bar in the pool. Get to this pool early to lay down your beach towel or you may not get a spot at the pool. Get's really crowded in the afternoon after the pool bar opens up @ 12. There are 2 decks also above the pool with lounge chairs and hammocks, palm tree's and sand. Nice set up. A liquor store across the street and shopping all along Coastal hwy. Lots of families and singles too. Breakfast buffet is a sweet deal a dollar more than their menu omelet price in fact and you get so much more. They also have an indoor pool, restaurant, & bar. Service was excellent. The hotel is a little dated but I found my room to be very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSESQ
Reviews.Content: we stayed over July 4th week and couldn't of been more pleased. the hotel came as advertised (although the outdoor pool did look a lot bigger on the web). we had a 6th floor king suite w/king bed and pull out sleeper sofa. the room also had a a small kitchenette w/electric stove, sink, microwave and full size fridge. you aint gonna cook thanksgiving dinner in it but it was more than adequate for our purposes. the rooom itself was plenty big for my wife, myself, daughter and nephew to sleep comfortably. the room was clean, the mattress, bedding and pillows on the king bed were first rate. the chambermaid gave us all the extra towels and linens we asked for annd the room was cleaned nicely every day. for my part, i appreciated the high quality towels that actually wrapped around my waist as well as the fact that there was enough water pressure and hot water for me to take a long, leisurely shower w/o a hot flash every time someone on my floor flushed the toilet. the removeable showerhead that doubled as a hand held was also a nice touch as well. finally, the A/C worked perfectly which was no small comfort during the god awful heatwave we endured while there. The hotel staff was first rate and GENUINELY friendly. We're not needy guests by anyone's standard but the few small requests we made were graciously accomodated. I've been to plenty of seasonal areas where the locals kind of resent the tourists but the people in maryland seemed to "get" the fact that us tourists represent the lifeblood of their economy and they truly made us feel welcomed both in the hotel and all over OC in general. There is a restaurant on premises that serves a continental breakfast buffet and doubles as a french retaurant in the evening. The food wasn;t great but we understand that coming from the NYC area our standards may be a bit more elevated than others. I've seen a couple of complaints about this hotel on the site but after staying there i'm thinking the authors of those opinions had unrealistic expectations going in. Ocean City is not the Hamptons and this hotel is not the 4 Seasons. If you're looking for that type of service/accomodations you probably shouldn't be in Ocean City in the 1st place. This area is a family oriented seaside resort town for people who want to bring their kids down to the beach for some good clean fun. plenty of water sports, boardwalk/beach type of stuff to do down here. it's also a very safe and reasonably priced area. as such, the hotel fits in perfectly. I'm sure i could come up w/some issues if i gave it a white glove inspection but they get the important things right which is all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: maddawg57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during fourth of July week. The staff was awesome and the room was even better. We stayed on the third floor in an ocean front room that was equiped with a stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave. I was a little hesitant at first of staying on third floor because I wanted to be on a higher floor for the views, but it turned out to be perfect because we had easy access to the pool without having to take an elevator and the views were still great. The pool was great and so was the beach. Overall it was a wonderful experience for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! This review is long but honest!”
Reviews.Author: Ateerys B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 06/28/12 - 06/30/12. I must say I was highly impressed! The staff, waitors and bartenders were very attentive & friendly! We arrived about 2 hrs before check-in time and they didn't give us any problems. We didn't like the view from the room they initially put us in so we requested another room and they changed our room with no problem and the view from the 4th floor was spectacular, overlooking the entire beach and pool area. Everything was clean & neat. The Reflections and The Sterling restaraunts were excellent! The service was awesome! The food was great! OMG! The honey drizzled biscuits with the whipped salty butter is to die for, later we ordered 9 biscuits to go! The alcoholic beverages were delish and they didn't skim on the alcohol! The other guests were very friendly and respectful. Nice family atmosphere and pet friendly. The hotel wasn't noisy. This hotel is a true beach front, practically sits on the ocean. The hotel was like a little resort. You really don't have to leave this hotel for anything except to go to the boardwalk, which is kind of far, not within walking distance. But it's nice to be away from all the noise and traffic of the boardwalk. Swim up pool side outdoor bar, indoor bar, plenty of hammocks, 2 good restaurants, fast food restaraunt outside, kiddie pool, indoor and outdoor pool, indoor jacuzzi, nice clean pathways complete with trees and greenery that are well kept, very small game room (not very entertaining for kids), gym room, computer room, huge tennis court (which will be renovated into a larger pool area soon according to staff), dvd players in room, flat screen LG tv's, kitchenette has all the little amenities (completed with full fridge, toaster, electric stove, can opener, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, we found silver ware!, cabinets, dishwashing/dishwasher liquid). The maintainance crew responds very quickly. There's a liquor store right across the street, along with some other little stores and a roof top club/bar. Beds were clean and soft, we slept very well. My only complaint/suggestion ~ if you want a good view stay at or above the 4th floor. It can be a bit noisy from the 3rd floor on down because of the people traffic. You must be specific about the type of view you want, if that is important to you. The rooms feel a bit moist because it's right on the beach so it can be a littly musty/misty feeling but it's not that bad. It was a little pricey but worth it. I will stay at this hotel everytime I go to OCMD!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa432
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel and was very pleased! The hotel was clean and the staff were readily available to help. The housekeeps were extremely efficent! They would change the bed linens everyday unless you indicated otherwise. They also vaccumed the room every day due to the sand from the beach and all! Very efficient housekeepin staff!!! The only thing is the outdoor pool is small and there are not many chairs around the pool (considering the room capacity for this hotel). We spent much of our time at the ocean so this really didn't affect us to much. The bar/grill by the pool is really good and very affordable for families. Everyday there is something for the children to do (cooking lesson, zumba, or majic show) this is displayed on the tv in the lobby--which is not the easiest way to find out what is offereing for the kids. Since it is not displayed long and is displayed with many other advertisements...but it is nice they have something for the kids :) The hotel does provide fresh fruit oranges, apples and bananas in basket by the check in/out desk. It was nice to have that amendity. Thanks Holiday Inn for the nice stay and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: MaryPatN
Reviews.Content: Great location (on the beach), great room layout (mini kitchen and living area), great amenity layout (pool off the beach), but needs LOTS of work... Needs a ton of maintenance and a deep and thorough cleaning inside and outside -- including our room. Once the property is brought up to par, a checklist needs to be used by all Maintenance and Cleaning Staff (and Management needs to ensure that everything is checked off) every day to be sure that everything is clean, neat and tidy. BTW -- breakfast located onsite was the worst we have ever experienced. Needless to say, we did not eat there but one time. We were very disappointed in this property and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: junglemono
Reviews.Content: We were very welcome since the moment we walked out of our car, front desk was very attentive, our room was clean and with a great view to the water. They front desk were very nice to my 9 year old son, he felt very special. I will definitely be back..

Reviews.Title: “Horror Week”
Reviews.Author: capmity
Reviews.Content: Bathroom ceiling leak. Told it was because of people in room above---So, do something about it. Front desk manager would not let me talk with Gen. Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: evag15
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying at the Holiday Inn and will not be the last. The staff are very helpful, the location perfect, the pool side restaurant and bar are . great. We tried the hotel restaurant this time and to my surprise the food was delicious, its a little dark and old looking, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: Barb44613
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference, and was very impressed with the amenities. I had a beautiful room with a balcony looking out to the ocean, and the room was more of a suite--small table, full refrigerator, microwave, stove, etc. Plus a little sitting area with couch and flat screen tv. In the morning they put out complimentary fruit, and there was also free coffee available. Only downside was dark halls leading to outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great price from Booking.com... and the guys at the front desk upgraded us”
Reviews.Author: Rache1128
Reviews.Content: At this point I'm a huge tripadvisor user... so naturally I referenced the reviews on various Ocean City, MD hotels before picking one off of Booking.com. I always read the "Terrible" reviews first... and as long as I don't see anything about bed bugs, blood, trash left in the room, etc, then I pretty much figure that every place will have SOMETHING bad and book the place anyway. So that was this case with Holiday Inn. We booked it last minute for about 150 (that's AFTER tax and included a breakfast in the morning). We arrived pretty late... around 12:30 AM... and when we got there I asked them if we could have a room with a view of the ocean. The guys at the front desk were SO incredibly nice and had no problem upgrading us. They also answered many questions that we had about the beaches around Ocean City as well as Assateague and Chincoteague (that's really why we were staying over in the first place... we're from PA and wanted an easier drive in the morning down to Assateague Island). The location was great. It's right off of 65th street... which is not by the main part of the Boardwalk but for me that was perfect because there was less noise. The actual property is literally off of the beach (very clean beach)... where we went for a walk for a few minutes at night before turning in to bed. The room we got was very clean and had a balcony AND a kitchenette (which apparently all of the rooms have). If we had been staying for the week this would have been perfect. Oh, and also, parking was completely free. Such a breath of fresh air, considering I'm used to being nickeled and dimed for things like that. The included breakfast was okay... it was a buffet and there wasn't much to choose from... but we had a $20 credit and *could have* ordered off of the menu. The buffet was filling enough though... and had eggs, more than some hotel continental breakfasts have.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well appointed accomodations”
Reviews.Author: fearslady
Reviews.Content: Attended a seminar at this hotel in May. Rooms were immaculately clean and well laid out, beds were comfortable and parking was plentiful. Outdoor pool area looked very nice and of course the beach and ocean is right outside. Downside.....I could not afford to stay here when peak seasonal rates are in effect, and the HVAC isn't the greatest but is ok......if you are looking to freeze yourself with A/C this is not the place for you. Also, there is no continental breakfast of any kind, probably due to the overpriced onsite restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Andrea Y
Reviews.Content: Nice front desk staff bell boy greeted us which was nice. The hotel itself could use a major makeover and I think it would make it much more apealling especially the area with the elevators they are very dated. Rooms are clean like that they are eco-friendly and and trying to conserve water for towels and linens. Really loved the extra special touch of labeling the pillows. Nice view love the hammocks they were my fav part although we didnt use the pool bar love that they offer that luxury. Really like that flat screens in each room we were comfortable and felt accomadated. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach spot to use reward points”
Reviews.Author: ErinDoc
Reviews.Content: I have been vacationing in Ocean City, MD for most of my life, and I've stayed with my family and/or friends all over. Last year, my husband and I used my Priority Club reward points to stay at this Holiday Inn. It was great! Since I have vacationed among palm trees in the Caribbean, it was so fun to see palm trees along the beach here. The swim up pool bar is fantastic as well as the hammocks in the sand. There were a lot of kids, but it is Ocean City, MD...what did I expect?! The rooms were nice. I was impressed with the kitchenette. The bathrooms were a little small, but overall we would definitely use our points to stay there again. I think that the nightly rates are a little high for what you are getting, but that is just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: mjbot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Mothers Day weekend. It was before the "season" so our room was very affordable. No upgrades with our Platinum membership due to them being sold out. That was a bummer. I did book ocean front so we left the balcony door open with the screen shut and listened to the ocean all night! Didnt get much of a breeze, I guess its the way the building is built?? IDK? The balconies have a table and chair and we liked to sit out there as well. The pool wasent opened but it looked like with the swim up bar it would be a fun place. It was a little bit of a hike to get to the beach. We were ok with that ,but if someone was elderly or handicapped it might be a challange. Also, families with little ones and all the stuff you need with kids! LOL. We are past all that ,so we just dragged ourselves down and set up our spot. The hotel is clean and the staff is very nice. Could use some updating. I think they are working on that. The carpet in the hall is screaming 70's!!! Our room was one that had not been done yet. We heard that some have been done. The bathroom had some yucky peeling wall paper. Other than the need of updating it was fine. Ocean City is a huge summer family place and this property looks like it is well used! The happy hour specials in the bar were nicely priced, I had oysters that were small but good and the same for the peel and eat shrimp. The bar tender gave us a hint about Fagers island as a nice place to watch the sunset. It was nice, not as good as the sun setting over the ocean but was nice. Thanks for the tip! We also ate at Laytons for breakfast, we like it there! Had some really good oysters at Bull on The Beach, I think that was what it was called. Find happy hours and you can drink and eat for cheap!!!! Over all we had a really nice weekend and I would stay here again. We might check it out next year at the same time . One really nice touch is that the management sent us a thanks for staying there note this week to our home!! That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of things to like, except for the mattress”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: Newish renovations make the place seem quite pleasant. Great service, friendly staff. The floors do have a bit of sway to them. The disability room for my spouse was okay. Great water pressure on hand-held wand for bathing. Lovely views of ocean, excellent fitness center, free wi-fi everywhere that NEVER conked out... indoor and outdoor pools, including hot tubs. Bed linens were high quality. Just wish the matress had been too. Bed seemed to cave with my 250 pounds in it and I woke with a stiff back each day. Close to beach with pretty dunes and lots of sand. Ate in the Reflections restaurant one night (reviewed separately). Breakfast buffet was inexpensive, but not much to write home about. Some noises from other rooms, but nothing disturbing. Kitchen with dishes, stove, microwave, sink, fridge would be handy for some, although we didn't use them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: vatravler20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and was very pleased. The hotel was clean. The room was nice. It had a sleeper sofa, king bed, a nice kitchen with a microwave and a small bar table with stools. Hotel was clean and staff was very nice. They gave me free water and granola bars when I checked in. The resturant, Reflections, was good althought the service was a little slow. Bath is small but very nice and recently updated. It was very clean with plenty of towels. The room even had a DVD player. Room was large. For the off-season price I was very pleased with my stay. Beach access with pool and swim up bar was not open but they looked good. Also has a tanning bed, exercise room, free coffee and the drink machines don't charge an arm and a leg. Save yourself some money and get an south or east facing room (rather than the more expensive oceanfront room). All rooms have an ocean view but get one above the 3rd floor if you want to see the ocean - trees and dunes are in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Best OC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alisha S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights in April and I was very happy with my stay.Nice friendly staff, Clean hotel. I had an eastern oceanfront and woke up to the sound of the beach every morning, which was very relaxing. Housekeeping staff was very pleasant and made sure I had everything I needed. They have a nice bar with three awesome bartenders. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be directly on the beach with great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the "Holiday Inn" name”
Reviews.Author: VVorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: As stated in other reviews, there is currently construction going on at the property, but other than the inconvenience of rerouting, we heard no noise and the workers are all professional and focused on their jobs. However, the whole building needs complete renovations... After checking in (with a very courteous front desk staff I might add), we took the elevators up to the room. Before even getting to the room, we had to walk down the hallway where the floors are so off kilter that there is the constant impression that it will collapse at any moment - easily 5-10 degrees off level down the length of the hall. The door to our room was warped and would not close completely (you have to use your body weight to push the door enough to close the security latch) and the layout of the room was horrible - if you open the front door all the way, it bangs into the table that is in the kitchen area (and dont even get me started on the way that the bathroom is designed). Speaking of the bathrooms, it was very disappointed to see old, frayed towels being hung in a Holiday Inn - we arent talking slightly used...we are talking ones that have long since been donated to the local community college since they are no longer presentable to company. Just embarrassing. The hotel does offer breakfast vouchers for their guests, so we tried Reflections one morning. Only one morning. We were there during the week so it wasnt the buffet and it was highly disappointing. Eggs: overcooked. Potatoes: old, soggy, and tasteless. Bacon: cold, coagulated grease. I am hoping that it was just a poor reheat, but regardless, it was so nasty that we left it on the plate and drove down to McDonalds. Depressing. We wont stay here again and we were very disappointed with this hotel. Stay somewhere (anywhere) else and you will be much happier...

Reviews.Title: “One less property to choose for next visit to Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: alzsailor
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was disappointing and not typical of other Holiday Inn stays. Layout of lobby and first two floors is very confusing. The room had an excellent view and balcony but couldn't get the sliding glass door open. Room smelled musty but that is typical of a beach property. I needed to leave a day early. I went to the front desk early and told the young woman that I wouldn't be staying another night and needed to check out. She brought up my room and said with a smile that I was free to check out anytime...but I was still being charged for the night. The clerk and her manager proceeded to treat me like I was trying to rip them off by wanting money back on a special rate. This conference rate was the same as the online rate on their website. They were turning away customers that were calling in looking for rooms while they lectured me about policy. Nobody can lecture you about policy like a 20 something assistant manager and her team. In the end they did me the favor of refunding the nights stay but made sure I understood I had to be out by 11. The desk staff was young and inexperienced. The could use coaching on how to handle special requests and that their being right is not always the best thing for the customer or the owners. I will continue to stay at other Holiday Inn properties, but not at the one in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close to Beach”
Reviews.Author: qtdesignz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here over East break. I was concerned about the indoor pool. There was a person pouring granulated clorine in it when there were swimmers in the pool. they looked like 25 bags dumped at a time, 3 times! Can't be good for the body!

Reviews.Title: “Great SeaSide Escape Holiday Inn Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: Marsha B
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience that our ladies had this past weekend at the Holiday Inn Oceanfront! The hotel was wonderful and the service that we received was excellent!!! From the time that we entered the lobby when we checked in until the time that we exited the lobby when we left, the people of the hotel were great. The were so very helpful and always smiling and friendly. The meals that were prepared for us were delicious and the staff and servers were great! Whatever we needed or wanted was arranged for us. The rooms were great! Plenty of room, clean. All of the details down to the large bowl of fresh fruit in the lobby from the time you got up until the time you went to bed. I would greatly recommend the Holiday Inn Oceanfront on 67th Street Ocean City, Maryland A shout out to Warren Lloyd, Kim Mueller, Keri Kurger, Janet (restaurant manager), Jewels, each of the servers for our meals and to all of the great people at the front counter!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very pleasant, relaxing weekend retreat.”
Reviews.Author: ECOGGG
Reviews.Content: This was a first-class experience for thirty women of all ages who came together for a time of spiritual refreshment and reflection. Thanks to all of the staff for making it a memorable stay. You're the best.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: bccam
Reviews.Content: I guess a had somewhat higher expectations for this hotel by reading some of the reviews. Although I can’t say that it is a bad hotel, I can’t rate it more than average. We visited OC in the last weekend of March when the city was hosting a cheerleading competition with thousands of participants. So I can’t comment on the price as it was probably inflated in all hotels because of this event. Here are my impressions: Positive - Right in front of the beach – nice! - Room has a good size for a family of 4 , with 2 double beds and sofa bed - It has a kitchen (although very small) - Restaurant is good and has 2 options, fine dining and casual Negative - Everything looks old and worn out from hallways and elevators to bathroom and refrigerator - It’s far from the boardwalk (2.5 miles) and the most picturesque part of the town. - At the end, as a “thank you” gift for our stay, the hotel refused to extend my check-out time for just 1 hour (I can’t imagine that they would have many new guests arriving on a Sunday afternoon in off-season). They instead tried to sell me another night stay for discounted price. Overall it was an ok stay. But if returning to OC I would try to stay on a walking distance to the boardwalk and on a newer or recently renovated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kristin s
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a one night stay to a room with a "kitchenette" - which would have been helpful if we were staying longer. The indoor pool was under repair and partially roped off and the the "hot" tub was more like a "warm" tub. The bathroom fan and heat lamp were about falling out of the ceiling. Finally, when arriving back to the room at about midnight, it smelled of cigarette smoke - despite being on a non-smoking floor. Called the front desk and no other rooms were avail and was promised someone would be up to check it out. Waited for an hour...no one came! smell was strongest in the bathroom so I assume the guests in the room next door were smoking and the odor was coming from there. Had it not been midnight, I would have packed up and went elsewhere.Ended up spraying body spray to get rid of the smell and kept the bathroom door closed. Upon checkout, I informed the front desk manager and she did apologize and gave our family coupons for free breakfast in the restaurant. Would not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst traveling experience”
Reviews.Author: Erin N
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. After this experience, I would not recommend any Holiday Inn, Expedia, or even Ocean City to anyone. When we made our recommendation, we called what we thought was the holiday inn reservation line. When the Expedia representative answered the phone, he simply stated " reservation line". We were assured a non-smoking room and were put in a smoking room that smelled of smoke so severely, it was as if we were smoking. I think the rooms have adjoining vents. We complained to numerous staff members and were told repeatedly there was "nothing they could do". We were told we have to call Expedia with any complaints (about their hotel?). When I called Expedia, I was told there was "nothing they could do" and that I should have complained to the hotel staff while I was there. Long story short, neither place was helpful and my children with severe allergies were uncomfortable the entire stay. Please take my advice and do not stay at this hotel and DO NOT use Expedia/Hotel planner for reservations. The hotel itself is a 2 star at best. Very disappointed in the dishonesty and total lack of concern that both Holiday Inn and Expedia displayed. Promising a person non-smoking and then saying "there is nothing we can do" should be illegal. You are selling a product, knowing that product is not at all what is expected or promised to the customer, just to make a dollar.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent experience and the front desk was very friendly and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: chioni3
Reviews.Content: Last week we came down to her away for the day. Jason the front desk associate was so helpful. Got us set up with the priority club and saved us money. He got us an upgraded room. So then this week we decided to come visit again because last week went so we'll and wasn't too costly. Jason was at the desk again and there was another guy kevin. Both were very friendly and helped us out again with a great room and deal. This time we stayed two nights. Honestly visiting ocean city is one of our favorite places to come but Jason and kevin made us only want to come to the holiday inn. The customer service was far better thenthat amy place I have ever stayed. These guys are a true asset to the business. More hotels need employees like them. I wish people where always so friendly like them.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: 410Syl
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful. I had to stay at this hotel several times in recent months and was never disappointed. The breakfasts are served a la carte in winter, though there is supposed to be a buffet type during the summer season. The dinners I had there were exceptional, and the wine list is extensive. Prices are in range for Ocean City hotels and the resort's better restaurants. I liked the complimentary news paper in the morning; also the coffee and fresh fruit that is available 24/7. I would stay there anytime. .

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: milwife2003
Reviews.Content: You are warmly welcomed as soon as you arrive by the front desk. Check in was extremely easy! The hotel and our room were very clean. We had an oceanfront room with an amazing view and again the room was extremely clean and amazing. We weren't even in the room five minutes and we had a call from the front desk welcoming us. We travel a lot as a family and we have never encountered that before. The next morning we ordered room service because the prices were about the same as you would spend to leave the hotel. My family of four enjoyed the food very much. We only stayed one night but I don't think I would stay anywhere else when visiting OC again. We have stayed at a few other hotels in OC and have never received the service we did or have stay in a place as clean as this hotel. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, relaxing stay, superior food”
Reviews.Author: krward4
Reviews.Content: I can not say how much we enjoyed our stay at this property. The rooms were spacious, clean and had great ocean views. We even had a room with a fireplace!!! A wonderful way to spend our anniversary. The restaurant, Reflections, is superior. The food, service and decor is top notch. You must have at least one meal there. Front desk was helpful, informative and kind. Try to get a room on the 8th floor!!!!! As an added bonus, the rooms have kitchenettes, a must for family trips!!!! Eat at crab bags, get there early, there is always a wait. Happy Jack's was excellent for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: julie B
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a 3 day getaway. I was told we would be upgraded upon check in since we were a member of the Priority Club. Once we checked in & found our room we had not been upgraded The fireplace that was in the room made such a racket we were unable to use it. The refrigerator compressor made a horrible racket each time it cut off & on. We also noticed holes in the wall by the bed & one of the electric sockets were hanging sideways & you could see behind it. My Husband dropped his keys on the floor beside the bed & could not help but notice a chip bag & one sock under the bed. The indoor pool was freezing & when we got in the hot tub and I took my hand out of the water I pulled up a handful or hair. GROSS !!!!! We have stayed here many years & I am sad to say we won't be going back. We could have stayed at several other places & now I wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Break away”
Reviews.Author: amy k
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, pool good, nice workout room, food and service good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for an off season get away”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: Out hotel stay was very nice overall. The hotel itself is somewhat dated and could use some remodeling. Although it's not so run down that you fear someone died in the room the night before you checked in. It's more of a '"Miami Vice" was still on the air the last time this room was decorated' kind of feel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We had an 8th floor room that faced the ocean and it had a small but nice balcony. Waking up to the sunrise over the ocean and the sound of the waves hitting the beach was a great way to start the day. The two hot tubs in the pool area were a nice benefit as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Made My Stay!! Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: Beth N
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Ocean City, and my trip was amazing as well was my stay at the Holiday Inn. Being a General Manager of a hotel myself I was so impressed from the moment I walked into the lobby. I was greeted with a huge smile by Kevin & Scott, and felt that they truly cared about the guest. Going above and beyond to ensure we were completely satisfied, when the staff shows they care it means more to the guest then anything else. The room was clean, quiet and refreshing. Upon checkout I had left a very special necklace on the bathroom sink, and had called the desk to ask if they found it. They had located the necklace and without hesitation told me they would mail it to me. I can not express enough how much It meant to me that they took the time to go locate the necklace and without hesitation got my address and it arrived a few days later. Kudos to the team at the Holiday Inn Ocean City. The Management staff should be commended for empowering their staff to be such great leaders while they are not around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel All Year Round”
Reviews.Author: Courtney G
Reviews.Content: We stay at this location about 3 times a year and every time it is pleasant. Whether you are coming in the summer to enjoy the beach, or coming in the winter to enjoy some peace and quiet, this place is just PERFECT! As soon as you walk in you are greeted by smiling, up-beat, front-desk workers that are ready to help with any request we had. The lobby looks very nice and has a very "at home" feel. The last time we went we were given a room on the 6-floor, I believe it was called Southern View. It was a very VERY nice view. We were able to over look the nice pool and garden area (even though the pool was covered) and then to the left was the beach. Even though it was a little chilly we did get a chance to sit on the balcony and enjoy the Ocean. The room is very spacious and it even includes a FULL KITCHEN! It has a very nice fire place in it which we definitely used on the cold nights. The beds, couch and chairs were very comfy. I didn't want to get out of bed in the morning because the bed was very comfortable. All the amenities of the hotel are nice and up to date. They have a fitness center that is recently changed, an indoor pool with hot tubs, a tanning bed, game room, and a business center! The restaurant is definitely a hidden gem. The food is some of the best I have had in recent memory. The last time I went I had the prime rib and it was flawless. The cream of crab soup was by far the best I have ever had. And the service was that of a 5-star restaurant. All in all, the Holiday Inn Oceanfront is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. And I look forward to staying there many more times in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Had a girl's weekend at the beach and stayed on the 7th floor of the Holiday Inn. Room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Had a great view of the beach and a saw a beautiful sunrise. The front desk staff when we checked in, Jason & Scott were very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back and recommend to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in OC!

Reviews.Title: “MY ALL TIME FAVORITE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sarah E
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is not just your average, everyday, standard hotel; in fact, its more like a palace to me. I love this place not just for one reason, but for many. I'm a perfectionist and the service and staff at the Holiday Inn exceeded my standards. I felt like a princess staying in a huge pink castle: Ive been in 3 different rooms and I could not find one thing wrong in any of them! * Each room is equipped with a stove, dishwasher, dishes,and a full size refrigerator . Not to mention a beautiful sofa, and an awesome flat screen TV. There are even rooms that have fireplaces. Also, every room has a balcony and I fell in love with the amazing scenery that I experienced from each balcony. * Not only are the rooms fabulous, but the accommodations are excellent ! There are 2 hot-tubs, and an indoor & outdoor pool. There's also a TANNING BED, GAME ROOM , GYM, conference room, tennis court and a 5 star restaurant. The staff also plays a huge role in making the Holiday Inn such a wonderful place. I would like to recognize Jason Palmer and Kevin Lloyd (front desk associates) for going above and beyond to ensure guest- satisfaction. These gentlemen are extremely friendly, welcoming ,patient and courteous. Although they are professional, they have an awesome sense of humor. I found it necessary to recognize these individuals because they made such a positive impact on my stay. Additionally, I'd like to recognize the rest of the staff for doing an outstanding job of keeping the hotel clean and up to par! Whether your taking a family vacation, hanging out with friends, on a romantic getaway, or staying for business purposes, this hotel is perfect for everyone, and I recommend it more than any other hotel in the area! My fiance and I had an amazing romantic getaway, and it wouldn't have been half as fabulous if it wasn't at The Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times a year for the past 5 years, both on and off season. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean. With the exception of the first 2 floors, all rooms have a great view of the pool and ocean. The most expensivie room, 1st floor, direct ocean view/access is really not worth the money. You can not see the ocean at all. If your on a family vacation with children, this might be a good location because it has direct access right off the beach. The pool is fun and the pool bar has the greatest bartenders. We enjoy our visit each and everytime we have been....this is the only hotel we have stayed at in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For the Price in an Ideal Spot”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for a Bachelor party back in October for 3 nights. It was off season but there seemed to be alot of things going on at the hotel at that time. The hotel is located in an excellent location. It is right on the beach and has hammocks around the pool as well as a beach bar! Perect for the summer. There are also alot of restarunts and stores around the hotel. Fagers Island is also a quick 10 minute walk down the street and is a place you must go to!!! The hotel itself was in pretty good shape and had everything you needed. There is a great restaraunt and bar off of the main lobby which is a nice spot for food or drinks. The rooms were very big with a nice balcony overlooking the beach and the pool. The bathrooms were also very big and very clean. They do a great job of maintaining the hotel and for the price it is definatley worth it! Do not be afraid to stay at this hotel and have fun at the beach or with a drink on the hammocks around the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Fine overall experience”
Reviews.Author: desilady1
Reviews.Content: Fine experience overall. We were there right before Labor Day weekend in August & wanted a family friendly, reliable name-brand hotel. We go to OC almost every August, so this was one of the better hotels. Room – it was a nice size room with a wonderful view of the Ocean & pool area. Rooms must have had “outside” entrances prior to the enclosure because there was a “lip on the door” to get in & out of the room. Check in was easy & the people were super nice. Kids liked using the elevator that had a large window to the outside. We always found a parking (which was free since we were staygin at eth hotel) space. Restaurant – Reflections was almost too busy for breakfast. It’s a small restaurant, so they can’t accommodate a lot of people. Kids under 12 eat free, so that was a good deal but the proportions are really small. We ended up driving to fast food places or walking to the nearby grocery store for cereal, snacks & wine. They did have free whole fresh fruit (in the lobby) & free coffee and hot tea (near the indoor pool), so if that’s all you need – then you are fine. For dinner we would drive to the boardwalk – it’s wayyy too far to walk – so we had more choices. Outside Bar – right near outside pool & beach, so it was easy to get a snack, drink or lunch. The prices are comparable to a diner. Outside pool – was small and would get crowded quickly. They had some nice hammocks nearby, but none were in the shade so they didn’t seem used much. It was nestled between the hotel & beach, so it had a nice atmosphere. Some other hotels pools face a parking lot or offered no shade, this pool was better. Inside pool & gym – inside pool was small, dark and unattractive. Many times they didn’t have towels. Free gym is across from the inside pool, but we never used the equipment. It seemed pretty average. Tennis court & kids’ activities – every day they had kids activities on the tennis court or inside a conference room. Mostly simple things like making an ice sundae, but they were free and it gave our kids another activity to do. Tennis courts were nice & were right next to the outdoor pool. I think you can get rackets for free – not sure since we didn’t play tennis. Beach – great beach – bring your own umbrella & chairs (& towels) – as they can be pricey if you have to rent them each day. It can get crowded, so if you walk a few feet away from the hotel area you can have more room.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Visit To Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Akron
Reviews.Content: Almost every fall we take a trip to Ocean City and places south. We know the area around the Holiday Inn so we stay there. The off season room rates are fantastic. The people are super friendly. The internet worked OK. We spent an evening in the lounge watching football. The shrimp there is fantastic. The rooms are a little small but the rooms have a private porch.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City Before the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: loverat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a weekend trip to the Delaware/Maryland area the week before Christmas, so we stayed for one night at the beautiful Holiday Inn in Ocean City. The hotel is right on the beach, very well kept property and very luxurious. Check in was a breeze and parking was ample and convenient and the price of the room was fantastic! We received a discount coupon if we ate at the Reflections Restaurant (in the lobby of the Holiday Inn). The food was great, just a bit pricey, but we were happy to use our coupon and had a lovely, relaxing meal. There is a very nice indoor pool/hot tub which we relaxed in after dinner. What we liked was that it was open until Midnight, so no rushing after we ate to visit the pool area! Our room was very nice, however there was a mini-kitchen that was kind of crammed in there. It had a dishwasher and a stove, wish I guess would be great if you are staying for a week or so, but for an overnight it was a little bulky, especially when you factor in the little table and chairs. We did love our balcony and the beautiful view of the Atlantic Ocean. Overall, this was a great place to stay and we will probably do so again!

Reviews.Title: “A little run down - but very nice and great location.”
Reviews.Author: twins3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a Friend and our 3 kids (all 12 year old) and had a nice time. the room was perfect for us and it was nice to have the little kitchen. unfortunately, my daughter got hurt and I thought we would have to leave, but they let us barrow a wheel chair and a beach wheel chair. that saved the trip for her.

Reviews.Title: “Matters what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Riesst
Reviews.Content: In November on a midweek day Ocean City is as dead as it can be. We intended to make a booking at the Holiday Inn Express, but I clicked the wrong hotel and we ended up at the Holiday Inn. We had a rock bottom rate of less than USD 50.- and therefore could not complain. The bright lobby does not reflect the shabby gangways and the worn out elevators. The room was more or less clean, however the linens and the towels were spotless. The small kitchen in the room did not look fresh and would be too small to prepare any serious food. When I opened the cupboard if found drinking unclean crockery. We did not come for cooking and would have loved to have a room without kitchen, but there was apparently none. More serious was that the shower tap did not function properly, the sliding door of the cupboard fell out from the sliding rails each time we opened it and no prime channels such as HBO were available. A quick fix refurbishing does not make an old hotel new. The internet was slow, even with the low occupancy rate. We had a bargain. For a higher price, there must be better choices in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service. Stands apart from the rest”
Reviews.Author: Manmap
Reviews.Content: I would recommend to anyone looking for an ocean front hotel for a great location and outstanding personalized service

Reviews.Title: “Don't sleep here..a nightmare waiting to happen”
Reviews.Author: johnmacarthursr
Reviews.Content: Now this may be hard to believe, but anything run by the Harrison Group should be avoided like the plague. This group manages several hotels and restaurants in Ocean City. The are long on promises and terribly short on delivery. We encountered them at several points in our planning. We visited many of their sites. We, like most trusting consumers were stupid enough to believe their sales pitch, accept their "no problem", and enter an agreement with them. It began innocently enough. We wanted a hotel with access to the beach. Our search led us to quite a few above the Route 90 bridge. After spending a good part of one morning, we had just about decided on one venue and we decided to check with the Oceanfront Holiday Inn. Of course our group was not the largest of the season, but we expected to need between 10 and 15 rooms. The manager took us on a tour of the property, finishing with a visit to the top floor of the Ocean front rooms. There were three of them on the top floor. We wanted a smoking room and were told that these were the only smoking rooms on the Ocean front. The manager said there would be no problem guaranteeing one of the rooms. Lourdes shared phone calls and emails with the hotel staff regarding prices and how guests would be able to guarantee the promised rate. Things were moving very smoothly. Imagine our shock and surprise when we checked in the Thursday evening before the wedding to discover that the room saved for us was on the second floor and non-smoking. The manager on duty began his corporate trained drone "We can not guarantee any rooms. This is the only room that fits your criteria." We pointed out that it did not fit our criteria and it was not what we were promised. The young man, true to the Harrison Group model of "Kiss my a**, you are here and stuck with what we decide to give you", began repeating the same mantra over and over again. He told us that if we wanted a top floor room, he had one that was overlooking the pool. He gave us a room key and we went a looked. Lourdes allowed that we had no choice but to make the best of the situation but she would only take a room if she could have the end unit. We returned to the front desk. Friends that had flown in for the wedding were coming in the front door. They waited to check in while Lourdes made her request. The young man replied, "I'm sorry, the end unit is being held for a member of your party." I asked, "How is that possible, you said you did not guarantee rooms." The lad countered with "No sir, you are wrong. I said we could not guarantee specific rooms. The people we are holding it for requested a top floor room." I then asked him if the room he offered and the room he was holding were exactly the same type of rooms, the only difference is one is in the middle of the building and one is at the end of the building." He said "Yes sir, but we are holding the room at the end of the building for a member of your party." The room was being held for our guests, they stepped up and said they were fine with a room in the middle of the building. We were then given the room at the end of the building. Lourdes then asked "Will we be refunded the difference?" Mr. Harrison Group looked stunned, "No mam, you will not receive a refund. You are not due any money." Lourdes pointed out that the room we were promised and the room we were given were not the same price. She pointed out that we should not be charged the higher rate. The manager looked her in the eye and said "No. You are wrong. You are not due any money." At this point I allowed "Son, you are in over your head, get your boss on the phone." His retort was, "No sir, you are wrong. I have worked for the Harrison Group for several years and I know exactly what I am doing." Lourdes once again tried to point out the error of his ways. He suddenly said "OK, maybe we do owe you a refund." I will not bore you with the rest of the exchange. It involved the hotel being unable to locate reservations and desk personnel speaking rudely when asked any questions. Maybe the people working for the Harrison Group have a problem dealing with people that actually expect to receive what they were promised. The day of the wedding, another of our guests decided to eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant (another of the typical Harrison Group establishments). They were seated. A very pleasant mixed race couple and their two daughters. They placed their order and waited. Several groups of golfers came in a placed their orders. (The Harrison Group also brings in golfing groups). The golfers received their meals and paid and left. Our friends were still sitting there. Finally, the mom stood up and walked into the kitchen and told them it was time to bring out their meal...now. She was met with blank stares. Eventually the meals were served, almost an hour after being ordered. Maybe the people working for the Harrison Group have a problem dealing with people that aren't part of the golf package deals. Our visit came to an end and we began to pack. As I was sitting on the bed, the head board came off and crashed to the floor. Lourdes had her wedding bouquet in a vase and our portion of the wedding cake in a box. I went downstairs to check out and let them know the bed had fallen apart. I stopped in the restaurant and asked the waitress if they had a walk-in refrigerator that we could store the flowers and cake in while we enjoyed on last morning on the beach. She said no problem. I went to the front desk to check out and told them about the bed falling apart. The clerk laughed and said "Oh, you're the newly weds. Don't worry about it." Lourdes came down with the luggage. I went to put it in the car while she took the flowers and cake to the restaurant. She encountered a different waitress that told her she would have to check with her manager first. She disappeared in the kitchen to find the manager. I came in and Lourdes was still standing there. She told me she would be right back and went back into the kitchen.
