The waitress that had gone seeking the manager was standing in the kitchen talking on her cell phone. Lourdes asked "I thought you were going to get the manager?" The girl replied "I haven't seen her yet." Lourdes said "you have left me standing out front for 15 minutes, waiting for you to bring the manager." The waitress replied "Look lady, I'm not even on the clock." and turned and walked away. "I am the customer here. You can not treat me like this. I only asked you to do your job." The girl kept on walking. Lourdes picked up the flowers and the cake and came out of the kitchen as angry as I have ever seen her. "Doesn't she know I am the customer and I don't know if she is on the clock or not?" We left...I don't think we will be back. Maybe the Harrison Group doesn't have a problem with anyone. Maybe the Harrison Group doesn't care about anything other than lining their pockets. After all, they make money off of tourists and they have their customers by the "short hairs" by the time they show up. It may not put a dent in their business, but it is only fair to warn everyone. This company is horrid and void of any semblance of integrity or customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Off Season in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: guinn777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great year round; don't get me wrong. In the summer it's the place to stay when you want fun in the sun. The pool bar is their best attraction. However, I was recently in Ocean City for a bike ride and found this hotel to be just PERFECT for off season fun. The indoor pool and 2 hot tubs are great. Not to mention they are open until Midnight. The out door pool is still open if you don't mind the cool fall air. The biggest plus is the hotel is super clean every where you go...the parking lot, hallways, out door areas, pools, even the sand is clean. The staff has to be the best I have experienced at any hotel in Ocean City Maryland. Janitors, Housekeeping, and front desk people were all pleasant, helpful and courteous. Everyone says hello and good morning to you. The rooms have great bedding and mattresses. Bed Bath and Body works shampoo and soaps! Do yourself a favor and book your room here. You are close to everything fun in Ocean City, MD. (Dead Greddies, Seacrets, Fager's Island.)

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right on the beach, rooms comfortable and moderately priced. Amenities including indoor pool, business center, tennis court, outdoor pool and hammocks add a lot to the value.

Reviews.Title: “Best B-Day Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sherry C
Reviews.Content: Went to OC to celebrate my birthday and was very pleased with the Holiday Inn. We arrived early and checked to see if the room was ready. The front desk staff said our room would be ready shortly and would contact us on our cell. We went out by the pool and before we could finish our first drink, the room was ready. Our clean suite had a great view of the bay and the ocean. The pool was crystal clear and I enjoyed a good book lying in the hammock. Although there was plenty of parking at the hotel, it was Sun Fest weekend with no parking at the inlet, which was fine because the bus stop is right out front. The hotel allows for easy beach access with sand walkways and showers. It's cool how they use the old palm trees as tables after they die in the winter. After our nightly beach walk, we would relax in the hot tub. We met the friendly bartender one afternoon and had a fantastic drink and a bowl of oyster stew at the restaurant bar. We plan on visiting again and will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn OCMD”
Reviews.Author: Charlie W
Reviews.Content: Overall very happy with the hotel, convenience, location, personal and room. Though room was a little dated and worn it was clean and comfortable and I could hear and see the ocean. Yeah. Great food in restaurant and very close to all the places we love to go. I would recommend this hotel to anyone we will be having our annual trek to Ocean City based here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Generous and Compassionate”
Reviews.Author: Frances G
Reviews.Content: Had a 6 night unexpected stay due to a family emergency. First night of stay our family member had taken a fall after walk on beach. She had broken her hip and fractured her shoulder. While in hospital after surgery she had suffered with some complications and stay became a day by day event. Family came on different days from another state allowing previous family member to return home. The Hotel staff allowed us to continue stay in same room, comped a few meals and comped stay. The staff was generous and compassionate. Our room/suite was clean, spacious and overlooked palm trees, hammocks, tennis court and pool with a side ocean view. It was relaxing after long stressful days spent at hospital. Every morning we opened the door to the current days' newspaper. We appreciate their kindness and the stay at a very nice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this holiday inn. It was very clean, the food was great. Our view was breath taking. Would recommend this Holiday Inn to others and will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: margezeak
Reviews.Content: I was in OC on vacation with a friend. We picked Holiday Inn by name. It was a good choice. The staff was exceptional. The rooms were very clean. The Hotel was convenient to everything we wanted. The service at the Hotel was wonderful and the fruit they had out at all times was a nice gesture. We will be back next year and will be booking our room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: 18Kathy1959
Reviews.Content: We go to OC MD every year we were very impressed with this Holliday Inn. The room was very clean. The staff was just wonderful! The pool was clean and the grounds were impecable. Everyone was so helpful and nice. The price was very reasonable for a room with a great view of the pool and ocean. All the bartenders were great they made you feel right at home at either the pool bar or the indoor bar. We charged everything to our room and I am happy to say that all the charges were very accurate. We will definately stay there again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: lovebug1975
Reviews.Content: I come to OC MD a lot last year alone I stayed 17 times. This year still working on it, I found this hotel late last year. I have stayed about 6 different times this year. I am already booking winter time to stay here. I love this hotel. The front desk people are so wonderful. Every time I returned or called on the phone they knew who I was. Everyone I talked to was very polite and took care of everything I needed. My room was very clean. The bed was so soft. The room was very big. The pool bar was very nice to hang out at. The bar tenders were very nice as well. The price for the room was a very good price. I did not have any bad experience. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: frank2958
Reviews.Content: Expedia mistakenly assigned us to this Holiday Inn. We attempted to have changed, but Expedia threatened to charge cancellation fee. So, we thought it best to stay with this choice. The staff was friendly. The room was located on side of the building. Expedia stated "Garden View". Holiday Inn did place us in a partially refurbished room. It was clean, furniture & carpet new. Bed was firm. We did not expect Kitchen facilites, but fridge and sink was handy. This area was cramped, with table against access wall. The kitchen facility and bath area was older but clean. The pool bar, outdoor cafe and access to the beach we great. Bathroom facility available from beach as well, rather having to go to room. All in all this Holiday Inn worked out for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Chell78
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in, things seemed ok. We got to our room and noticed how hot it was. Looking at the thermostat, the room was at 75 degrees with the A/C set to 68. The room was muggy so we turned down the A/C. I played with the thermostat for a bit and found the fans do not really change strength. And, seeing as the room temp didn't feel like it was changing, I dropped the A/C down to 60 degrees to get the room cooler quicker... or so I thought! Hours later, the room temp finally dropped to 70 degrees! We had to keep the A/C cranked low in order to keep the room cool. Second, we ordered a smoking room. There was no ash tray, so we called the front desk. During that time, a large thunderstorm rolled in. A waterspout occurred a few blocks down. When we went out in the hall to see what the commotion was about, we saw a hotel staff member running down the hall to show others the waterspout. After he made his comment about how he didn't care, he lives miles from here and is leaving now, he began to walk back toward the elevators. We noticed he had an ash tray in his had and asked if that was for our room number. He said 'yea' and stood there at the end or the hall with his hand stuck out to us instead of walking it to us at our room door. Third, shortly after the waterspout hit, the hotel lost power. The generators kicked in (which were noisy) and the power in the room flicked back on.... for about a second. We then had to sit in a hot hotel room with no power, no word of whether we should move to another location due to this waterspout, nothing. In about an hour or more the power returned. After that, we decided to get dinner. We returned to the hotel and, at that time, noticed the room had only reached 70 degrees after having the A/C on for 3.5 hours. After feeling very disappointed in Ocean City itself, we decided to go try and relax in the hot tub and pool. While in the pool, a couple came to the locked pool door (which you need a room key to enter - for a reason!!!) and began knocking on the door wanting us to open it and let them in. They were obviously here for bike week (they knew some of the other bikers in the pool). They had to return to their room for their key. Upon entering the pool, the man gave us an attitude saying 'gee, thanks for opening the door for us'. I honestly don't care - the door has a lock for a reason- just use your darn key! Then, he pulls out a martini shaker to drink while in the indoor pool - with signs posted everywhere for no food or drink there! We went to the front seek and complained about his comment and attitude and about how he was drinking alcohol while in the pool.. they didn't seem to honestly care. We also looked into whether we could get a refund and leave this hotel and go back to Virginia Beach which was much more pleasent. The manager, Kyle, came out and COULD NOT look us in the eye while he told us he could not refund the pre-booked room. We called Holiday Inn's customer service line to question this and they said the hotel has the power to do it IF they choose to do so. Well, obviously $$$ here means more than customer service! I work in management - making the customer happy is your number one priority. Also, when you handle a complaint, you LOOK the customer in the eye to show them you understand their issue and problem and you sincerely want to help. Last, we realizes we forgot to put the parking permit back on our dashboard after dinner. Upon returning to our room in the elevator, 4 of the bikers here for the week were discussing whether or not they should have a foresome together that night. A real place to bring a family! I will NEVER return to Ocean City Maryland as I think it is tooc ommercialized and chaotic and I will NEVER recommend this hotel or, quite possibly, any other Holiday Inn hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard cleanliness for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: makuawahine
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn needs to be gutted completely. The decor is dirty and dated. If you have the misfortune of forgetting to specify a non-smoking room you will smell like a cigarette throughout your stay. Even the linens smelled of smoke and the air cuts off automatically if you leave the door open. The front desk, restaurant and pool snack bar are under staffed, and the indoor areas were littered. We will not be returning. As far as the pool bar, it's okay, but expect drunks by the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Roll-In Shower not Accessible!”
Reviews.Author: RavensLady
Reviews.Content: Wanted a 3-day vacation with hubby and booked an accessible room with roll-in shower. Called front desk to confirm accessible room and they had it wrong. So they promised it was down and everything was fine. Showed up ( Dew Tour was in town, didn't know that when I booked it) and our room wasn't available until the next night, a mix-up again! So, we had to change rooms the next day (thank goodness I showered before we left) which basically killed our day. Then we finally get to the accessible room and the door to the b/r isn't wide enough! Even if it was the b/.r was so tiny you couldn't maneuver a w/c in there anyway. So I spent the remaining 2 days cleaning up in the kitchen sink. Thank goodness we were prepared w/ a trash bag to wash my hair leaning my head back into the sink. I also couldn't go out onto the balcony either and listen to the surf b/c the door wasn't wide enough. Anyone ever hear of the ADA? Also, w/c accessibility ends at the outdoor bar and pool area. From the pics you get the impression that you could go right up to where they're concrete ends and to the hammocks and be able to see the ocean. Not so! Also, the pool area was packed and the band so loud you couldn't think. The only reason this hotel didn't get a terrible rating was the staff. Front desk employees, bellhops were very friendly and did everything they could. Management only offered a refund AFTER I emailed and complained to corporate. A free breakfast doesn't cut it when you offer accessibility and then don't follow the ADA code! Lesson learned, ALWAYS CALL HOTEL AND GET DOOR MEASUREMENTS!

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghMOM2004
Reviews.Content: We loved the beach off this hotel~so much more relaxed than closer to the boardwalk staff was great--very accomodating I completely disagree with complaints on cleanliness. I thought the place was amazingly clean. There were staff constantly keeping hallways washed and free of dirt and grime (no small feat for a hotel with direct beach access) Boardwalk is a bit of a trip--but worth the trade-off to us for the quietness of the beach. The pool was somewhat small and very crowded with drinkers--but I guess that is to be excpected when you chose a hotel with a pool bar We really enjoyed the view from the balcony. Kitchen amenitites allowed us to make our own breakfast to have on the balcony

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool bar!!”
Reviews.Author: chrismcrawford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I look forward to and have the best time at this hotel each year, AND WE LOVE THE SWIM UP POOL BAR! I'm sort of a health nut and like to do laps while I'm there. I sit out in the sun, do some people watching, get all warmed up, jump in the deep end, swim up to the bar, get a drink, then get back to my chair or sit on one of the benches in the pool. That's a lap and push myself to do a lot of them :). The bartenders at the pool bar are the best in all of Ocean City. "Quick with a joke or light of your smoke", make the best restaraunt recommendations, and are just all around great guys. I highly recommend any of their signature drinks like the Dirty Banana, RumRunner, or Bushwhacker, you won't be disappointed. This is the only place we'll stay and are looking forward to going next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the mony”
Reviews.Author: MoPeep
Reviews.Content: Not a bad property for they cost. Rooms are reasonable. Requires a bit of maintenance. Beach is nice with good access. Indoor and outdoor pool are good in case of rain. My wife says she dislikes that there is no clothes line for drying clothes after a day in the waterl

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the POOL BAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julee H
Reviews.Content: OK...so the hotel is not 5 stars, but management is nice and anytime I asked for anything, i usually got it. Forget all that ...The PoolBar makes it all worthwhile!! They have the 3 best bartenders in the world...quick, friendly, and make great restaurant recommendations!! This was summer #8 for us, and we do not even consider other hotels...because of the fabulous POOL BAR!!! The dirty bananas are a MUST TRY!! Definitely try out this hotel...and did I mention....The POOL BAR is AWESOME!!! GO quickly...the bar closes Sept 24!!! julee

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but this was'nt cheap!”
Reviews.Author: sxxxydiva
Reviews.Content: First time in OC and can't say I'll stay here unless I'm desperate! Outdated, dirty, and not the most friendliest staff. What a vacation. We got the breakfast package and most days was a 30 minute wait. The restaurant could not Baccomodate its 216 rooms. The pool and swimup bar were decent but the water was frozen for Aug. The kiddie pool had icecubes in it and the towels always ran out. Awful. The beds were tiny full size beds and when we pulled out the sofabed there was food under the mattress. The family before us also left behind some fishes behind the dresser that housekeeping never found. Gross. My only kudos goes to Robert, the omelet station guy. What a sweetheart. He was an exchange student doing his masters in business. Hopefully he'll come back and help this dump out!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again...but needs some better upkeeping in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumgirl0608
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a great time. Check in and out was easy and staff was very friendly. There were lots of activities for the kids to do (all ages). Loved the idea that they had a kids cooking class. The arcade is very small, but the kids still enjoyed it. All the outdoor amenities were in excellent condition. Even though the outdoor pool is kinda small, we never felt that it was too crowded. The rooms definatly need a face lift and some better upkeeping. The screen to the porch was compeltely torn (the kids showed us how they could crawl through it), the door handle to the porch was torn off and could look through the hole where it was. The bathroom had visible mold and really needed to be updated. The kitchette was definatly handy, but was not fully stocked with supplies. Necessities that you need to actually make a meal were missing. When we called to the front desk to ask for a frying pan they said they would check and then we never heard back from them. Don't except good housekeeping services either, each day they pretty much made the beds, vacummed and restocked towels....nothing was wiped down or actually cleaned. Like I said we really did have a great time, great location with the ocean front view and a quick walk to the beach. the fresh fruit bar in the morning that they advertise is rotten fruit...seriously rotten every morning. The resturant was also an added bonus, service and food were good. The beds were nothing special, but were very clean. Also for the entire hotel there are two washers and two dryers, so expect to wait to get in to do your laundry!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, smelly, dirty, old and run down”
Reviews.Author: zzzzz z
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and this is my first review ever written. I feel compelled to dissuade anyone from staying here. My family stayed here for 2 nights and that was too many nights for us. The smell of mildew in the room was interesting. The AC did not cool the room. There was mildew on the ceilings in the room and in the bathroom. There was rust on portions of any metal in the room. The carpet was torn and worn and old. Wallpaper falling off the wall. The pull-out couch was disgusting. Frankly, we were afraid of sleeping at night for fear of bed bugs. My husband checked all of the beds for bed bugs and we kept our luggages zipped shut. We plan to leave the luggages in our unattached garage when we get home. Hopefully we didn't take any "souvenirs" home with us from this hotel. Our family even wore our flip flops in the shower. This hotel has to be completely redone from top to bottom. Throw all furniture out., rip up carpets, paint, get a new AC overhaul. Maybe if your drunk and here to drink, you won't notice the uncleanliness. This I believe was the reason there are 4 and 5 stars from the above reviews. But any person of sound mind would not stay here. Normally I would have walked out after seeing the room, but a friend sent us here as a gift. We did not want to offend. But it was disgusting. My teen and I stayed up most of the night because we worried about possible bed bugs.and we slept full clothed to cover us completely. Kitchen? What kitchen? I guess it is technically a kitchen. Do your self a favor, go some place else. I can't believe that anyone would pay $269 a night to stay here or even $100 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: al b b
Reviews.Content: The Hotel needs a make over. Renovations are needed ASAP. My Family Travel often and we were all very disappointed with the hotel. The carpets are Dirty and worn out the pull out sofa looked old. We did not sleep on the beds we used air mattresses. The Bathroom is Directly behind the door so you are locked in the bathroom if you have the room door open. There is no private area , No vanity or small area to change. I tired to switch rooms but was told all rooms are the same. I tried to switch hotels but there were no rooms available anywhere. The photos on the web site must have been taken over 20 years ago. The room and pool area appear bigger on line. The Tennis courts and shuffle board were ok. You need to sign up for these ammenities. Thank goodness for the pool bars two staff members they were helpful with our dining plans. We were basically Robbed For $269 Per night for an old, small, dated hotel room. We thought all holiday inns were kept up to a certain standard. We were so wrong to Assume. Definitely never returning to Ocean City. :p We were very happy to return to the Bronx., NY

Reviews.Title: “this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: Someone needs to take a bulldozer and push this property into the ocean. I would be embarrassed to be called the manager of this facility. It is run down from top to bottom - carpets are stained, paint is old, bathroom tiles are from the seventies - as well as the kitchen. I feel like a sucker for paying close to $200 a night - my only hope, that we have to evacuate due to Hurricane Irene and I get all my money back...

Reviews.Title: “Nice time, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisKaren1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 2011 thurs-sat with priority club points. Hotel was clean for a beach hotel, service was wonderful, parking was a breeze. Elevators slow, pool not great for toddlers. A bit more "get drunk and party" than we prefer, but still a great stay. Getting from the room to the beach with a 2 yr old and 8 month old is not super easy because there are quite a few steps unless you walk around the hotel. I still like thebBoardwalk HI better because of the pool, but this one was a nice change of pace. Great location within walking distance of many activities, a little store, a few restaurants and a Ritas!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities for vacationing families for the Price”
Reviews.Author: vactnwkids
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a less-expensive Garden View Room. Pros: Room was very clean. Service was excellent. Indoor and Outdoor pools. On-the-Beach. Tennis Court, Hot Tubs, Outdoor Eatery and Bar. Daily activies for children (usually around 4 or 5pm). Large Balconies. Comfortable beds. Fully stocked kitchen, sofa and large TV. Pool Towels were provided (sometimes). Great location away from the boardwalk. Cons: Pools sometimes got very busy, but other times were quiet. So, a bigger outdoor pool would be nice. Air conditioning did not go below 66 degrees. Kitchen was small, not much room to store food. Bathroom has limited space for all your toiletries. Other: No alcohol allowed on beach which is probably a good thing. Room was big enough for our family (2 adults and 3 tweens). Lots of parking. We felt safe. Bring ext. cord for electronics. Umbrella and chair rentals available on beach. Beach store and alcohol across the street. Small grocery store nearby but expensive. Bring your own PB&J and oreos.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandKim9
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel. I had two rooms. I will start by saying that we paid what I feel is a lot for the rooms. I wouldn't consider it dirty but it is a little worn and in need of basic repairs. They had to replace our refrigerator the first day due to it not getting cold for example. One room unfortunately was across from what I guess is the room that has the garbage shoot. The smell in the hall was interesting. The entire five days. There are two bars outside and one inside. Everyone we talked to outside working them was very nice. They were helpful and made us feel at home. Can't say enough about them! The restaurant in the hotel was the surprise. After having some less than spectacular meals off site we decided to give them a try. Turns out it was quite good! Great service and wonderful food! If I had known it was that good we would have eaten there every night.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great room”
Reviews.Author: WXinDC
Reviews.Content: Our preferred hotel at 1701 Atlantic Ave was full, so we stayed here. I think we got a handicapped accessible room; the shower water ran under the curtain into the rest of the room (not in a tub, but probably wheelchair accessible), there were NO little shelves in the shower for shampoo or bottle of liquid soap. No Jacuzzi. Bed was good, but the boardwalk does not extend this far north, so an evening stroll was not as nice. Neighborhood was noisy with lots of traffic. The restaurant was great! Service in the restaurant was great.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: JennieWandishin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, stayed at the Holiday Inn for Memorial Day weekend (Sunday through Tuesday). The hotel staff was extremely accomodating, and the pool is amazing. There is a great swim-up pool bar, and the pool was crowded, but never overwhelmingly so.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover88884444
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of June and had a fantastic time. We had a ocean front room on the 3rd floor and it was great. The staff was very friendly-coming in from the beach made our room very sandy and they cleaned in everyday. Beach was walking distance which is what I wanted with 2 kids-11 yrs and 4 yrs. The kids loved the balcony also and so did my husband and I. There was a fox right outside our room in the dunes. The kitchen was great-we took all our food and cooked there. Great hotel-we will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mad4020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days at the end of July 2011 and had a fantastic time. We were a group of six adults and five children and we enjoyed all the facilities available to us. We spent most of the time at the pool. Although I agree with other reviewers regarding the Spring Break scene at the pool with the swim-up bar, there was plenty of room for kids to be kids and swim and play. The snack bar at the pool had great burgers and chicken tenders...we could have eaten dinner there and been plenty satisfied. What I found the most impressive was the cleanliness of the hotel. This is a very busy hotel with lots of moving parts and everything was spotless in our room, at the pool, etc. The kids enjoyed Carlos the Cascading Juggler and his fire juggling. We would definitely come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: marlene409
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable. The bed was very comfortable, and the A/C was quiet. The location was ideal, too. We also loved the balcony very much, even though we only had a side view, we could still see the ocean. The kitchenette was perfect, and the service was good. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-great location!”
Reviews.Author: TA14
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for about the fifth time in ten years last week. I have to say you can't beat the location. The hotel may be a bit outdated but it was clean, the employees were very good, the pool/pool bar was great, and it was in the best location. Not too far up the coastal highway but close to great restaurants, stores, etc. The price may be a bit high for the overall need for updating but they do have a great setup. Restaurant isn't cheap. Leave the hotel and go to the strip for your meals. Having a larger refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, and stove was also a big plus with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Place grew on me..”
Reviews.Author: Fetbuzzy
Reviews.Content: I'm here now with my husband and 4 kids ages 9-12 and place has grown on me...I like this location, its not on boardwalk but I actually like that. Drove in I dont like being amidst all that chaos. Ok so it has a kitchen...good. a little sparse with supplies so bring bowls if you plan on making salad or something papergoods. They have a superfresh for groceries. Nice pool, lots of kids mixed with folks drinking at swim up bar. Get chair reserved early by 9am in summer. Nice beach right past pool. Fruit out every morning Vhs tapes (they were out of dvd players) Little unsophisticated gameroom good for blowing about 20 bucks in 10 minutes Indoor pool decent but SMALL AND LOUD WITH KIDS. I wouldn't get in it but kids liked it. Overall they cleaned A LOT but place is rough...used hard but its literally on the beach so it seems dirty. Our room was average. Bring Lysol. Ask for first floor STAFF WAS GREAT Overall if you have basic expectations go with kids and aren't too worried if its a bit sandy and dirty you"ll be ok. OUR KIDS LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet - Great vistas”
Reviews.Author: brwnys
Reviews.Content: We had planned on staying at another resort but decided to stay here due to the convenience and access to the beach from the pool. It wasn't crowded, the pool was lovely and the room was clean. For the price I don't think we could have asked for more. It is quiet to sit out on the balcony and listen to the ocean late at night. The one bed wasn't as "new' as the other but we were able to make due, They do not have king size beds. For the price and convenience, this is the place to stay if you don't want to be close to the boardwalk. We never even missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a great beach vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ksvoboda6
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are clean. Pool and pool bar are fantastic. Food was great. Beach was clean -not overcrowded. Liquor store and swim shop across the street. Quick drive to the boardwalk. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay / Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kandrewz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in late June 2011. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and we were allowed to check-in early. They followed up with a call about 30 minutes after check-in to make sure our room was OK and to see if we needed anything. Simple but you won't find that level of service in most hotels. The room itself was clean and good size for the four of us. The kitchen area in the room was a little outdated but nothing to get into a twist about - It was just fine to make a few lunches and a breakfast or two. The carpets were very clean in the room and the hotel itself was clean and smelled fresh. The beach was close enough for our 3 and 4 year old to walk on their own and they enjoyed a juggling show on the tennis courts one evening and a balloon maker / magician in the lobby on another day. There were kids activities planned for nearly every day of the week. The pool was decent size and the swim up bar was pretty good. Some other reviews pointed towards an out of control crowd at the pool area but we didn't see anything like that the few days that we were at the hotel. There were quite a few families with small children as well as younger couples and singles staying at the hotel. Everyone was in good form and there was a friendly atmosphere throughout. We're generally hotel snobs and were a bit worried about the other reviews but we would definitely stay here again and will go back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Service was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rioandraymie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this Holiday Inn. We were traveling with twin 9 month olds and a two year old. The bellman Corey was fantastic. Not only did he help with all the infant equipment (pack and play, boosters, sand toys, car seats) and all the luggage, he made it fun for the two year old allowing her to "help" push the cart. He gave us tips on where to shop for groceries and souveniers at the best rate. The front desk help was also amazing at getting us into a room after a long night drive. The housekeeping service was great bringing extra towels for the babies as well as disposing of the diapers to avoid smells! We had an excellent dining experience in the Reflections restaurant. Our server was so friendly and helped to keep the twins entertained with crackers and fruit. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. Last but not least the maintenance man was so generous to help us when our car battery died avoiding a delay to return home. Although this is an old hotel, it was clean. The management should be proud of their staff. It was the "human factor" that made this a very pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere here and good solid rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZBTUsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little dated now in its fixtures and fittings, but the suites were really functional with a nice little kitchen (fully equipped) as well as a sitting area and balcony. The bed were very comfortable and there was a choice of pillows. Downstairs, there was an indoor and outdoor pool. The outdoor pool had a pool bar which was fun. There was a nice little pool snack bar as well. Then you just opened a gate and there was the beach which was great. There was a grocery store not far away and across the road was a beer and wine shop. Overall, it was a slightly dated hotel and was in need of a really good clean (I admit I'm quite fussy), but it had a great atmosphere and was full of happy families. Staying there on a week night, it was quite quiet in the hallways and I had a wonderful night's sleep there. We also had a good last-minute deal on it, so I was very happy with the value.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items”
Reviews.Author: Claud12
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed staying in Holiday Inn hotel chains; every time I have traveled, I received nothing but great customer service and always recommended the Holiday Inn to friends and family. However, after my last stay I am extremely displeased. During my stay my wallet was removed from room 119. Although the hotel provided a safe in my room, I was unable to use it because the door to the closet, in which the safe was located, was broken and restricted my access to the safe. Prior to my discovery of the broken closet door, I had already called maintenance to fix the broken balcony door and I did not feel the need to call again, so I kept my wallet in my gym bag, which was located on the luggage rack. In addition the Hotel Manager was rude, provided poor customer service and failed to conduct a reasonable investigation into my claim. Rather than apologize for providing me a room with broken doors or for the failure of the maintenance staff to repair these defects during my stay, he repeatedly stated that I should have called maintenance specifically to fix the broken closet door and that I should have used the safe. As stated earlier, I had placed one call for maintenance services and I was not aware that it was a guest’s responsibility to 1) ensure the services are completed or 2) that a guest’s request for maintenance services nullified the Holiday Inn’s responsibility from providing me an adequate and secure room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family location”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and we enjoyed it. The pool is so tiny and is completely full most of the day....like so full that people just stand, not actually swim. It is full of boozers and smokers. I'm sure this is the situation because the surf was so amazingly rough that there were literally only about 2 people in the ocean. I have no idea if that is always the case, but it was that way the whole 4 days we spent there. If you like lots of booze and skin and horny 17-24 yr olds, then this place is for you. For a family w/ young teens...not so much. This isn't the hotel's fault per se....but left us with an overall "we'll never come here again" taste in our mouths. Might be different if the pool was a little bigger, but it is very tiny. Staff was very friendly. Fruit at the front desk was a nice touch. Great to have a fridge, etc. to give you more eating options. We have stayed at many beach hotels around the world and have seen a lot....but this crowd takes the cake. Never again to ocean city. Not the hotel's fault though.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: anhunt617
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here a couple days before Memorial Day weekend and loved it. The hotel/room was very clean, king size bed was super comfortable and the room had a great view of the ocean. We didn't get a chance to visit the outdoor pool and tiki bar but it looked like a lot of fun. The only downside of this place was that the indoor pool left something to be desired. It was not the nicest room but the pool was plenty big. We definately will stay here again on our future trips to OC

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice About This One - it's like spring break in a dive hotel”
Reviews.Author: doin_a_travelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn about two summers ago. It was so horrible, I had to comment even though it's been awhile. We had a corner room with a really nice view. Beyond that there was nothing pleasant about this hotel. I think someone who knows nothing about hotel maintenance runs this one. It was in such bad shape. The outside and inside of this hotel were dirty! The room was dirty, so dirty I cleaned the the kitchen before we used it. The carpet was in incredibly poor shape. The elevators were rickety. Everything was dirty and worn! For close to $400 a night you expect more. My biggest complaint was the pool.... it had pieces missing and broken and had dangerous, uneven tiles and pavement. Just like so many other people commented, It is a pool with a bar in it... reminds me of spring break in college. The water gets so crowded and cloudy by 3 in the afternoon, you can't swim in it for all the people wading and drinking and smoking. Defintely not a place for families and kids... Unless you are young and like to booze it up.... THINK TWICE ABOUT THIS HOTEL.!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Travelerat102
Reviews.Content: We checked in 5/26 and all was calm and beautiful. By noon on Friday the pool and pool bar was rocking with the 20 and 30 year old party crowd. The pool area was so crowded with partygoers that it looked like the neighborhood pool bar. We partied at that age too but it wasn't a scene I would want my kids seeing on a family vacation. The rooms were okay but they need renovated. The view from our room was great but ask questions before reserving. Some rooms look onto the beach but you cannot see beyond the tennis courts and/or pool. We prefer the Holiday Inn at Boardwalk and 17th Street. It is newer, nicer, more convenient, and has all the same amenities in a family environment. It is a bit more expensive but well worth it for the discriminating traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: 1sttyma
Reviews.Content: Expected more for the price. The pics make the place look great but when we arrived in the lobby we knew it wasn't going to be good. I'm used to Holiday Inn hotels in other states like NY, CA, VA where it's a decent 3.5 star or better. In my opinion this place is more like a 2 star. The room is basic and no frills. It felt dirty and ichy. It just seemed really low budget to me and not even comfortable for our weekend stay. Even the maids clothes were dirty. I didn't want her cleaning anything because she looked more contaminated than anything else. I would definitely not stay here again. The outdoor pool is over run by college students and THE over boozed/undersexed. The indoor pool was full of toddlers. My 13yr decided to take her chances at the beach after reviewing her options. Next time I may opt for a condo rental instead. I get the impression all these hotels are functioning at 2 stars despite their name. There is a kitchenette and microwave. If your not fussy like me then come on down but if you are like me -go else where.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for your over the top help.”
Reviews.Author: lolad1
Reviews.Content: i have been having a horrible time over the last few months with priority club.When trying to redeem my points.And when i was making my reservations for the weekend i was made to feel as it i were taking advantage of the program .But the staff and management at the Holiday Inn at Ocean City 6600 Coastal Highway went over and above when helping me work things out . Thank You Melinda Duchaine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and pleasantly surprised.........!!!”
Reviews.Author: Superbird540
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled up I just assumed it was another beach type hotel but upon checking in and going up to our room all i could say was WOW.....Nice room, and we got the direct ocean view suite with very nice amenities (kitchen with microwave, dishwasher, full-size fridge, sink, dishes/pots/pans/silverware- and even the Palmolive to wash the dished by hand if we chose!~) Room service was excellent, food quality was great, and we ate our first morning's breakfast out on the balcony (4th flr) overlooking the ocean and the beach.....They also have a nice outdoor pool and wet bar, and even hammocks which we took a nice cat nap. Beautiful sunsets/sunrises from the comfort of our own private balcony, and seen dolphins constantly- even a crafty smart fox catching his morning dinner for his pups out in the dunes! Very cool........ Staff was great and all stores and everything we needed was right at our fingertips. Very clean and comfortable hotel at a good price..........Only downside is $369/night during peak summer months is a little high as we wanted to book it again for July, but price is a little much for the $117/night we paid in late May in comparision- Are you listening Holiday Inn? bring it down to the low 2's for summertime please and we'll be permanent customers as are stay is in Wildwood NJ also........Loved the talking elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl417
Reviews.Content: Very well kept and equipped with just about everything! nice indoor and outdoor pool and hammocks very relaxing!!! private walk to beach! Clean, friendly staff, cozy, enjoyable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsSam5
Reviews.Content: loved the location, must be busy time if we came in the summer.We will try to come back and plan to take part in the guest appreciation promotion for nov-dec stay. the pool area is small, did not get a chance to visit the hotel rest. out the door all types of food places inexpensive for a family of 4/5. The hotel staff was friendly. the view looking over the garden allowed us to still see the ocean. GREAT STAY

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CWimer62
Reviews.Content: Perfectly centrally located in the middle of Ocean City. The rooms were clean and the staff was very, very nice. The whirlpool and pool were clean and in great working order. Even when the power went out due to a terrible east coast storm, the maintence man was walking around ensuring the safety of the patrons. Our room had a refrigerator, stove and sink - which was a nice touch. The curtain separating the living area from the the bed was a nice touch (I could watch TV without disrupting my wife who was trying to sleep). Highly recommended and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: I was provided a complimentary room at this hotel for a conference I was attending. We had arrived in Ocean City a few days earlier and had been staying in another hotel prior to this one, so when we checked out of our first hotel, we headed for the Holiday Inn. It was only about 12 noon, and I knew that check in wasn't till later in the day, but they were very accomodating and gave us our room immediately. And since I am a platinum Priority Club member they upgraded my room to direct oceanfront. I've stayed at this hotel many times and always enjoyed it. But it has been recently updated and is even nicer now. We had a problem with the transformer for the emergency lights, and the repairman was there within minutes of our telling them about it. He had it fixed in 5 minutes and we had no other issues the whole time. Everything was fresh, clean, and well maintained in the hotel. The pool was clean and warm, the free coffee was hot and plentiful, and we always enjoy the free fruit in the lobby. I reccommend this hotel to families, couples, business persons, senior citizens, and anyone who enjoys a comfortable, safe, clean hotel in the heart of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: iRockSocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! There is an indoor & outdoor pool (with a swim up bar!), 2 hot tubs, a baby pool, hammoks! There is soo much to do at the hotel, it was like a resort! Our room had a king sized bed, a flat screen tv ( with LOTS of channels) and a whole kitchen! It was great! The staff was wonderful. They even have portable cribs to use for the kids to sleep in (but they were kind of rikety :( ). It was the nicest hotel I have EVER benn it. I def. recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel but very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: RussellandLora
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, as was the view. However the maid stole my sunglasses. I contacted the hotel chain and the hotel itself many, many times and they did nothing to take care of the problem. I will not go back as if customer service is bad I do not give my business!

Reviews.Title: “Totally pleasant stay, very worth what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: justrateit
Reviews.Content: We had to come to Ocean city at this time of the year for my daughter's cheerleading competition event. There was not much else to do in Ocean City in Feburary but we enjoyed to stay in Holiday inn this year, as opposed to the very disappointing stay at another hotel last year. Overall the room is very neat and clean. Staff are very friendly. Restaurant serves nice food. Location is perfect too, very close to the convention center where our event was held. Overall a great value. We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve beachfront...”
Reviews.Author: bajablue
Reviews.Content: We had a great two night stay 12.31.2010_1.2.2010. Stayed in a direct oceanfront rm. Accomodations were great, room was spotless and had all the amenities you would need. Lobby was beautifully decorated, nice, helpful friendly front desk staff. Always had complimentary fresh fruit in the lobby..good "added value experience". Complimentary bottle of champagne was a nice touch as well.Fireworks right outside our room...not sure if that was the hotels doing or a guest but it was an excellent little light show. Will stay again, definately next New Years!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Room - Kept Thinking They Made an Accounting Mistake (It Was So Good!)”
Reviews.Author: R0AD_TRIPS_are_Fun
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the first trips where I didn't plan ahead - I just poked my Garmin and said I want to go HERE and found a hotel en route. I must have good karma or something - the location is great - right off the main drag. Everything, from lobby to room, was clean, fresh and comfortable. Since I was only here for a night, I didn't care if I had the ocean view rooms from the hotels across the street, but from my balcony I could sit and look at the ocean.. which is one of my favorite things to do with coffee on a chilly morning. When I got into my room, I thought it was a suite. It had a king bed (with FOUR pillows, 2 with ribbons around them marked firm, and 2 marked soft! I was so impressed with this alone!!) Then there is a living room area with a sleeper sofa and a flat screen TV hanging OVER THE FIREPLACE (did I mention my room had a fireplace??) TV is positioned so you can see it from the living room and the bed. Oh, and a full refrigerator, stove top, oven, dishwasher, sink, can opener, toaster, microwave and coffee pot.. And a very nice updated bathroom. All for $66.95 on a Friday night rate. With the incredibly affordable rate, I thought I would treat myself to room service - I ordered a French Dip sandwich with fries and a glass of wine. I was expecting a lunchmeat sandwich of some sort (or slightly better). OMG. It was REAL 1/4" sliced rib roast cooked medium rare (O-M-G) and the fries were awesome - they had some sort of batter on them that made them very tasty. Not too much. Just perfect. I really can't believe the value of this hotel.. If I was staying here for longer than a night, this is where I would stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant one day stay”
Reviews.Author: dltp
Reviews.Content: We had a larger than normal group so we had to squeeze in on the two beds in order to fit. It was an ok stay. We didn't really stay very long as we were out most of the time. We just wanted a place to stay in overnight and have somewhere where we can shower and clean up after being in the beach. The beds were comfortable and big enough for three people to sleep on. Everything was clean. It is a good place to stay if you're just looking for somewhere to crash after a day on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: lv2gar
Reviews.Content: The second we walked into the lobby I knew it was a mistake!!!!! THE SMELL OF MILDEW was overpowering,,,,, we got to our room old very dated smelly...... The veiw was ok but the noise was annoying ,ppl lettin their kids scream off the balcony just not what I was looking for. I thought we could listen to the ocean noises not ppl yelling and kids screaming....we had to close our door to block out the noise...The kitchen not enough stuff to cook with no silverware drawer it was in the cabinet.. When WE GOT HOME WE HAD TO WASH EVERYTHING IT SMELLED!!!!! We called for towels and have our trash picked up so we could leave it took them an hour to come up...They said I will send them up right away NOT TRUE I worked in hotels all my life and this was quite an experience....So you read this and see if you want to stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: OCMDBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations, affordably priced, very clean and well laid out. This hotel offers the best of the best when it comes to being comfortable at the beach. 2 Great restaurants, a pool bar, snack bar at the pool too! Have a nice tropical drink while lounging in the outdoor pool... and while the kids are in the children's pool.... or, go inside to the indoor pool and jacuzzi. Also, it wouldn't be the beach if you didn't go and relax on the very clean semi-private beach they have to offer. Also, there is a fitness center, business center, game room and a conference center for larger business groups. They do take part in Holiday Inn's Priority Club, so you can use the points you've collected at this hotel, and of course, add some!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THOUGHT IT WAS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: PASANDYBAY
Reviews.Content: We came here the day after Labor Day for 3 nights to celebrate our Anniversary. Since we planned to go to our favorite restaurant (Reflections), I thought we would just stay at the Holiday Inn. Our room, #709, had a south ocean view because it was cheaper than a full ocean view but it turned out better than we expected. In the morning, when we had our coffee out on the veranda along with the newspaper, which was delivered to our room every morning, we did not have the sun in our eyes as did the ones with a full ocean view. We overlooked the tennis court, swimming pool and the ocean. Our room was large with a king size bed, electric fireplace, sofa bed, and in the kitchen, we had a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, toaster and even an electric can opener along with the dishes, etc. Although they were a little outdated, it was great to be able to eat your left-over dinner the next day and it did not have to only be microwaved. I thought that our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a little on the small side but our bedroom/living room area was very large. The hotel had everything you could possible need -- 2 restaurants inside (1 casual and 1 top quality), a place at the pool to get a burger, etc., a swim-up bar, hammocks to lay in at the pool and plenty of lounge chairs and plenty of parking. We enjoyed talking to Yovar who is the bartender in the inside bar, which is very nice. You might be able to go to The Hilton or the other Holiday Inn and get a more updated kitchen but you won't get it for $147 a night, which is what we paid. I would definitely go back there to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JDub1969
Reviews.Content: Ocean City was wonderful, but this hotel was the pits. First, their web site (from the description to the picture) is totally misleading. The only true picture was the color of the hotel and the look of the lobby. It was the ONLY thing updated. It does not take much to please myself and the others in my party. Usually give us a clean room and a bed and we are okay. This hotel was anything but.... The balcony was filthy (sand and dirt all over the table and chairs), there was mold in the bathroom tub, food on the carpeted floor, broken ice bucket and ice cube tray, there was no safe in the room and the "safe deposit boxes" were not private at all, the pool was filthy, the sand under the swings was littered with cigarette butts and cups, the indoor pool was dirty, smelled musty, was cold and the surface around the pool was uneven and if you were not careful you could trip and fall. It was just so disappointing for a Holiday Inn. It is not the experience we thought we would have at all. Really investigate the hotels before booking... we learned our lesson for sure. I would go back to Ocean City MD in a heartbeat, but I will NEVER stay at this Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Good time!”
Reviews.Author: lmcmch
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the reviews that said this place was dirty! Our room was very clean and we were all pleased with our stay. Our only complaint was with the pool. It was a little small and on a Saturday became very crowded with the swim up pool bar. The picture of the pool was a little misleading but the rooms are much nicer than they appear. Overall, a nice place to stay and to relax,.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: nbateman
Reviews.Content: Good location: Tubby's, Galaxy 66 and Sky bar, Dough Roller, Seacrets all nearby. There was a chair, umbrella, boogie board rental stand right on the beach. The best part of the hotel was the pool and lounge area with hammocks. Although I didn't join in, there were free Zumba classes on the tennis court on Mon and Wed at 5pm. We watched from the hotel room and it looked fun! Didn't try out the restaurant in the hotel "Reflections", but did enjoy Galaxy 66 directly across the street. I've seen it a million times when driving by but never thought to try it out until I heard about how good it was from a co-worker. I'll review that seperately with pictures. Well it definitely was good...pricey but good. I was not impressed with the room because the double beds were tiny but they did have great pillows (4 firm and 4 soft) and the linens were nice too. Hallways were actually airconditioned and the pool was cleaned in the early morning (I've never seen a hotel pool get cleaned). The pool area was crowded in the afternoon and had to wait for some people to leave before we got a seat. Didn't get anything at the pool bar but the hammocks were great! Early in the morning lay out in the hammock for a bit before everyone is awake, it was great! I would stay here again but make sure I get a room with bigger beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our annual stay in Ocean City and once again had a lot of fun. We arrived early on Sunday, the desk gave us our parking pass, took a cell number and we headed to the beach. By 2 P.M. we were able to check into our room, and as promised we had a beautiful Southeast Oceanview room, up on the 6th floor with a great view. Our room was cleaned each day, a few times we needed to call for towels, but the desk always accomodated us. We enjoy the location and access to the beach. The full kitchen makes it easy and economical for breakfast and lunch. We are close to a variety of good restaurants and a quick trip to the boardwalk area. The outdoor pool is cleaned each day, perhaps the only objection is that it's not that large of a pool and includes a swim up bar which gets busy in the afternoon, especially on the weekend. With that said, there is also live entertainment at the pool on the weekends and I can recommend the outside restaurant for lunch and snacks. Food is well prepared and reasonably priced. The hotel is quiet at night, beds are very comfortable and the room easily accomodated my sister and I and two pre-teen girls. The hotel offers a number of children's programs and this year added Zumba classes. There's also a game room and indoor pool and the rooms are furnished with a flat screen TV and DVD player. This helped to while away some rainy hours. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “OK but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: murphytravelers
Reviews.Content: When we first got to our room it smelled a little musty, not totally uncommon for hotels on the beach but not pleasant either. We happened to have a bottle of febreeze in the car, so that helped. The room had a good view of the ocean and was fairly nice. It did seem a little mildewy (hopefully not moldy) in places like the bathroom. Our TV remote was missing so we had to call down for one. Then we discovered that the guest services book/room service menu was missing too. I had to ask for one at the restaurant but the next day (after our first room cleaning) there was one in the drawer with a tip envelope, right on the top. Coincidence? The room service was decent and was delivered within the promised time frame. The pool was nice with the sun decks and swim up bar and poolside grill (which was good). The only downside was when I left and came back one of the staff wanted to put a wrist band on me whereas I didn't have to have one on before. I'm not sure why checking my name and room number against the list wasn't sufficient. The wrist bands seemed tacky and unneccesary (and weird when you're trying to sunbathe) as the only way to get to the pool is really through the Hotel, I guess you could jump a fence off the beach but if you're trying that hard to "pool crash" ... more power to ya. The hotel has a restaurant, which is a plus. We had the breakfast buffett on our last day and the service was SLOW but the food was good although not as good as other local restaurants. The rooms aren't set up for wireless. And you have to request an ethernet cable even though the literature says each room comes with one. When my mom requested the cable she got put on a waiting list and we didn't get off the list by the time we checked out. The lobby has wireless but that's not really sufficient if you're dealing with sensitive information. Overall, I think its a decent deal for a quick stay at the beach with a good view, but I don't know if I'd stay for the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “We'll never cheat on Hilton Suites again!”
Reviews.Author: hkm516
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton suites last year but didn't want to pay so much this time. We chose this hotel. The restaurant service was horrendous...miserable and inefficient staff, charged for my 2 yr old daughter's buffet once but not the first time, resulting in attitude from the hostess, saw numerous peple waiting and complaining. The pool was my second issue. My daughter loves to swim and the baby pool was a joke...it was as big as a bathtub. Seriously. Maybe appropriate for a 6 month old baby. The "big" pool had a swim up bar..not family-friendly at all. My daughter was splashing around with about 20 drunk twenty-somethings. Yuck. No lounge chairs were available after about 9 am as everyone rushed down and put their towels on chairs and left! Asked about this and was told "people have complained but there's nothing we can do." Again, I'm comparing to the Hilton, which in my opinion, is amazing. The room was ok, nothing wrong with it, just reminded me of a hotel with outdoor corridors that was remodeled. Housekeeping service was fine. No room service menu or hotel information in the room either...we had to call to see when check-out time was. I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It's really OK”
Reviews.Author: Joe1195
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and the room was all you expect from a Holiday Inn. The facilities were what one would expect at an ocean resort. There is an indoor and an outdoor pool and, of course, the Atlantic Ocean. There is a business center, a game room an a more than decent restaurant. The poolside bar and grill was ok too. If you are looking for a seaside resort in OC, the Holiday Inn is fine. Just make sure you are not on the first floor where there is a lot of traffic and no ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean”
Reviews.Author: cewhitta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two days with my sisters, their children, my brother in law and mother and was not satisfied with the cleanliness. The sheets on the bed were dirty, the comforter actually had a few blood stains on them and I was given a dirty towel on another day. I stay at hotels frequently and would not stay there again on a return visit. The cost was $300 per night, and it wasn't worth it. Also, when I called the front desk and requested management, told them about the dirty comforter and asked to have them change our sheets, it took them about five hours to come up to the room. It didn't seem as if they were worried about satisfying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: My third time staying at this Holiday Inn and it won't be my last. Yes, this is a beach hotel - it is not the Hilton. If you go with that in mind you will be pleasantly surprised. Some thoughts: Outdoor Pool - awesome swim-up bar; band plays on Saturdays and Sundays; gets really crowded (think Spring Break crowded); blue collar type of crowd; nice service at the bar; convenient food shack next to pool; the crowd lightens up a bit on non-weekends; was appropriate for families with teens (my daughter loved the virgin daiquiris); I do wish they could make the entire pool age 12 and up only though bottom line: if you are coming here to party with a Jimmy Buffet mentality you will love it; if you are coming here to relax in a vacuum and have some quiet space then go somewhere else Beach - hammocks and sunning decks up above the bar/pool area; beach gets a bit crowded but seemed pretty normal to me (if you are an OBX desolation person this probably is not the town for you either) Hotel - room was spacious and clean; fridge/stove/sink; DVD player; fireplace; awesome deck that we spent a lot of time on bottom line: again, this is not Hilton luxury here but it certainly met my girlfriend's standards and she can be quite picky; it's a beach hotel with the average wear and tear that comes with that Other - the Galaxy across the street was good for a nice (somewhat expensive) meal; Big Peckers down the street is a good lower budget and family option; the bus runs up and down the strip for $2/day - great way to get down to the boardwalk and do your thing without having to worry about driving back; don't think I would want to stay down on the Boardwalk - visiting it was great, but staying there would probably not be a good bet in my book

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Alluneedisdabeach
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. We had an amazing view oc the ocean and spend a lot of time on the balcony. The rooms have two full beds and a pull out. Ther rooms have a kitchenette which was very handy for breakfasts because you can easily spend over 50$ on a meal if you're not careful (family of 4). The rooms had a plasma tv and a couch (aka the pullout bed). Also the whole wall facing the ocean was glass (window and door). Now to the beach. It is very busy on the weekends. So I sugggest that you come during the week. Also there are shells but most are broken. But oh well we found some awesome ones anyways. Last on the ocean the water can change DRAMATICALLY overnight. One day there was riptides, the next it was super calm. Bring boogie boards, btw. They have a restaurant downstairs called reflections too we only had our breakfasts there, great service. No it's not free:(. Last here are some things to just point out that you make sure of when your here... - money(duh) -breakfast food (bake in kitchenette) -sweatshirts (it gets cold) -SUNSCREEN (got real bad burn.. Only out there for at most 5 hrs a day but bad burns) -lotion (if u boogie board when you catch a wave when you come ashore knees scrape on the sand and over time your knees will get sand burn) okay I admit this info might not be too helpful but this is just what I got from my experience.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of updating rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rock342
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a 90 degree angle view of the beach. The furniture was outdated, there were hairs on our bathroom floor, and the room was in desperate need of a renovation. The front desk staff were young students, not very helpful, and usually too busy to give you the time of day. When I checked out, I didn't receive a receipt for my stay, and when I went to ask for one, the front desk person was onto something else. They denied someone late checkout, saying they needed all the rooms by 11 am as they were sold out, when someone else walked up and was told they had plenty of rooms. Not real impressed with this Holiday Inn. The outfdoor pool was nice but much smaller than the pictures, and the indoor pool was a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrsraider
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to OC, Md. We're so happy to have chosen this hotel. We stayed at this here the week of July 11th. We had a fantastic time here. This hotel is in a great location. Just a short drive from the boardwalk yet far enough not to have to deal with the noise or the crowds there. It's also located near many great restaurants and activites. This hotel is right on the beach so it was a very short distance to the water. The pool is great because it's situated behind the hotel, it's very private compare to the others on the strip that have their pools in their parking lots. My kids loved going to the beach in the early part of the day and then spending the rest of the afternoon in the outdoor pool. We love the food shack next to the pool. Great for a light afternoon snack. On the weekends it has such a festive atmosphere because of the live band that plays in the afternoon by the pool. My kids (17 yrs. old & 13 yrs. old) made great use of the indoor pool every night. The indoor pool was open till 12 midnight. The staff at the hotel are very pleasant and accomodating. They really go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one. The room was comfortable and large enough for a family of 4. It's great that they have all the amenities of home (kitchenette). The room had free internet service which was a plus. We loved sitting on the balcony with the table and chairs enjoying our morning coffee as well as sitting out there in the evening listening to the waves roll in. The view was spectacular! My kids loved staying here. They made lots of new friends. This location is great for families. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandma73034
Reviews.Content: This is the older of the Holiday Inns but is being refurbished. It is on the Ocean with an outdoor pool. Great Area for families with preteens/teens. Food at pool grill is great.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but not great”
Reviews.Author: hvccgolf
Reviews.Content: I realize this is a Holiday Inn, not the Ritz, and we were not expecting a great deal during our recent 4 night stay. In short, here's the Good and Not So Good.... The room was OK, not great, although it had a lovely view of the pool, beach and ocean. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony on the 6th floor and listening to the ocean and enjoying the view. Ask for a room that faces the ocean (some rooms are 90 degrees to the ocean). The common areas are OK. The front desk was prompt and courteous. The indoor pool is pretty dark and unpleasant, and do NOT come to this hotel for the indoor pool. Coffee was available each morning in the game room. My one beef is with the beds. They seemed clearly smaller than "full" size beds, as it felt like we were squeezed onto an oversized twin, and that was not conducive to good sleeping. We did not hang out at the outdoor pool but it looked very crowded, with seemingly at least twice as many people in the enclosed area as there should have been. Again, if you want a quiet and mellow pool scene, go elsewhere. On the positive side, they had a good live band on Sat and Sun afternoon that we enjoyed from our balcony. The bulk of people staying there seemed to have small kids, and this hotel seems perfectly suited to that. The beach was excellent - good waves, clean, and a minimum of shells and debris. I give the beach an "A". With resepct to Ocean City, I was astounded by the amount of traffic and a 6 lane busy highway running down the middle of it. It would take 3-4 minutes of waiting just to catch a traffic light to be able to cross to the local stores. if you want a quiet shore town, OC MD is not it. Also, we went jet skiing, and I recommend it. However, do not use the marina on 66th street. The young staff there could not have been more disinterested and listless, ordering on beligerant. They acted like accomodating tourists was the worst thing they could be doing that day. At up to $75 a head they should at least try to show a little gratitude. There are plenty of rental places so go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted, more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: senecadream
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Oceanfront was a great experience for a recent family wedding. It was planned on short notice and Gene and Janet with the Reflections restaurant were so accomodating in helping us to plan the post-wedding dinner for 20 people. The food was exceptional, the wait staff were all so wonderful - we had children as well as adults and they made sure that the children had food choices to suit them as well. The service was excellent! The dinner was everything we had hoped for and much more than we expected. We also received great service from the housekeeping and maintainence departments with things we needed - both responded promptly to our calls. All of the staff were friendly, our grandchildren made friends with Neri at the pool, the girls at the service desk and we all enjoyed the guys at the pool bar and outside grill. We stayed there last year and had such a good experience we suggested this as a destination for our daughter's wedding. Everyone traveled from out of state to attend, and we heard no complaints from anyone - only great things. It is a very family friendly hotel and in the summer months there are children activities nearly everyday including crafts, cooking classes and even a movie night with popcorn and the works! Our grandchildren have traveled alot and still insist this is there favorite place to vacation. We highly recommend it and cannot wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Find some place else”
Reviews.Author: HKNLADDER
Reviews.Content: The pool is super small (not like the picture showed) and is linked to a bar - which at first we thought would be fun but quickly realized its open to pretty much anyone off the street. They try to check who is a guest and who isn't but a few young-lady smile and winks to the pool staff and that quickly was overlooked. The pool is filled with beer and drunk people (unless you're into this) No one at the hotel really speaks english - so to order a crib to my room, I almost had to draw a picture on paper for the guy to get the idea what I was looking for. Room keys were not programmed correctly and failed to work twice. The room was ok - but old smelling. Lastly, even though they have 4 elevators, plan to wait - they are very slow. This is a NON family friendly hotel with little, if anything to offer for kids. We couldn't even find a ramp to get our stroller to the pool/kids pool. We had to walk around the building and still carry it up 8 stairs. (what about the disabled?) Not worth the stay - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Off Boardwalk Location...No Return”
Reviews.Author: winterking44
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to OCMD and we booked the room very last minute. The hotel is located near the middle of the strip and is not near the boardwalk as we later learned. We were ok with this as it made for less traffic near our hotel. The Boardwalk was nice to visit but equally nice to leave at the end of the night. We were able to check in early on a Friday and had a room on the first floor in the back facing the ocean(couldn't see the ocean from the room though). Overall the room was good - clean, nice beds, easy access to the beach and nice sitting area.. Room had a table in the small kitchen area that made it hard to get in and out of the room - we thought the table could've been removed for this particular room. Brought my laptop and both i phones and later learned that there is no WiFi in rooms, big disappointment. The hallways have a musty smell to them but that is expected at a beach hotel. Parking was free and the lots always had space. Front desk staff was friendly if somewhat inexperienced (summer help). We stayed two nights and didn't ask the maids to clean the room so unable to comment on that. Also didn't use the indoor or outdoor pool as we went to the beach instead. Due to our last minute plans the price was too high for what you got. If the room was about $75 to $100 less per night my rating would be higher. No general complaints but wouldn't stay again unless price was more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: yoshieninja
Reviews.Content: No military discount. The young lady at the front desk referred to me as "this guy" to another employee. I got to the room and there was a dying wasp by the window. Room service didnt leave new soap twice. No internet cable in the room - i had to ask to be put on a waiting list for a cable (whoever heard of this?). TV kept turning off and not responding to the remote. LOCATION is right on the beach, but far from boardwalk. I would recommend this hotel because if you are driving and want to be away from the young scene down on the boardwalk then the place is okay. The problems are surmountable by spending plenty of time out on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JamieBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here last week for 4 nights and we had a great time. The hotel room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. The kitchenette provided all the utensils we needed. Bathroom was okay, small but managable and could use some updating. The view of the ocean was fantastic. Service at the front desk was very good at providing help. Housekeeping goes around at night asking if you need anything. Only issue we had was the restaurant. The service was very slow but the food quality is good and the prices are not bad. I discovered later we were overcharged but the manager quickly fixed it and even took off extra due to the inconvenience. In regards to the outdoor pool area I loved it. I have seen previous reviews of spring break behavior but from what we saw most the people were decent. What do you expect when the pool offers a swim up bar but our family loved it and the grounds are very nice and maintained. Only bad part here was no hot tub. I was not very crazy with the indoor pool. It just smelled like chlorine. We never used it and it was not necessary for our stay. We also took advantage of the other hotel activities for the children which were very nice. My kids really enjoyed the cooking class and the tennis court was one of the best i've used. In regards to the beach this is one of the cleanest beaches i've seen and I use to live in Florida. I recommend this hotel very much and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “skip it--unless you are a springbreaker”
Reviews.Author: travelm0m2010
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn survives on the hormones of springbreakers. It was pretty digusting as an older adult traveling with mother. Pool was not even inviting unless you were bumping and grinding with everyone checked in at hotel. I won't stay here again. It was clean, but hotel should get a grip on allowable behavior for general public and vacationing families. Extremely noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jean1012
Reviews.Content: Love love love staying at the Holiday Inn Ocean Front hotel in Ocean City MD. This is our 2nd time staying here and had an awesome time. The hotel is extremely clean as were the two pools. Love the grill outside in the pool area as well as the poolside bar. The kids (5) and (1) had a total blast. Didnt have that icky hotel feeling when I left. The hotel is located on the beach which is also a plus ! The restaurant located in the hotel was fantastic....unbelieveable food for a fair price. The location 6600 Ocean Highway is a major plus as its in the middle of everything. Lots to do within walking distance from the hotel. The Galaxy Restaurant located across the street was awesome...great food and great drinks. Love love love everything about this hotel and will definetly come every year and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and would return again!”
Reviews.Author: DiveMstr2005
Reviews.Content: We purposefully booked this hotel far away from the boardwalk and downtown due to June being "senior month." With small children along, the heavy curtain separating our bed from the sofa and TV was a blessing.
