We were able to put them to sleep in our bed while we sat out on the balcony and enjoyed the rest of our evening. The kitchenette was the perfect size to make a small breakfast and lunch. The size and accoutrements in the bathroom were just fine as well. The kiddos loved the indoor pool and there were plenty of fresh towels. The front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Value”
Reviews.Author: bbigbri77
Reviews.Content: We spent countless hours reviewing and comparing hotels before planning our trip to Ocean City, as this was our first visit to OCMD. We were looking for a good sized room with a kitchen (to save cash on meals - very expensive to eat out in OCMD spending about $40-$60 per meal for a family of four). We wanted an ocean front east view, balcony, in door and outdoor pool, etc. Dollar for dollar this was the best deal we found in town. Easy access to everything since you are in the middle of the strip, friendly staff, and decent rooms. Our only complaint is that while the pool signs say hotel guests only, most of the people in the pool and bar area were not from the hotel - but the condos next door. We overheard several conversations about how easy the hotel pool was to 'sneak' into. Indeed the pool area from about noon-5pm was a very inappropriate scene for kids and teens and the while the swim up bar sounds fun, it only adds to the problem. That being said, after 5pm, the pool was nearly empty every evening, making up for the single circus earlier. The legend of the 40cent pop machines is true, and while the rooms were not flawless, we found them very comfortable with the maid staff doing a fine job turning over the rooms daily if desired. The beds were very comfortable and I had some of the best nights of sleep in months. The only other thing that caught me off guard was that they did not have WiFi and that bummed this laptop and iPad wielding family out a bit. I paid in advance to save another $150 or so off the stay and that made this hotel a great value for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad either”
Reviews.Author: MD11driver
Reviews.Content: Other than the lobby, most of the hotel interior needs renovations. Guest rooms and especially bathrooms are in need of updating. The beach and pool are clean. Pool bar has good service. The location is near a variety of bars and restaurants, however it is not near the central area of Ocean City or the boardwalk. You must drive to the boardwalk and most major attractions/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Vcation 2010”
Reviews.Author: zakmak74
Reviews.Content: Great room with fabulous view. 2 dbl beds, kitchen and eating area, living room area, and large bathroom. Indoor pool, weight room, arcade room with free coffee and hot chocolate. Outdoor pool with bar and grill and hammocks.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjf067
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel (Ocean Front) once or twice a year. We stay off season to get the lower rates. This fits into our once or twice yearly bird watching activities. We start at Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge then onto Ocean City where we use the hotel as a base to visit Assateaque Island National Seashore then onto Bombay Hook National WIldlife Refuge. After being outside in at times inclement weather it is great to get back to this hotel. The beds are very comfortable, it's quiet, and the views are great. We look forward to many more stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay.... If You Pay Full Price”
Reviews.Author: sigmagrrl
Reviews.Content: I really do like this hotel. I like it so much that I'm staying there again this upcoming weekend. I like its location, the much lauded $0.40 sodas, and the indoor pool area. But let me warn you: if you're someone who bought the room on Priceline/Hotwire, they are not receptive to requests at all. I have found that they will put you in the poopiest room, even if the room type you're requesting is available. I asked and the manager wasn't yielding at all. (I must also add that he wasn't exactly enthusiastic about having to help the front desk clerk look at the room inventory. It appears he was having some personal time with friends when we arrived. Having the manager and his friends in the lobby socializing seems a little unprofessional...). The rooms have a very convenient kitchenette area, coffee maker (they need to leave more coffee and creamers; they don't replenish on a daily basis if not asked, nor was our coffee pot cleaned. I attribute this all to it being off season, but you'd think the housekeepers would have more time to clean their assigned rooms if it wasn't as busy?). The bathrooms are simply fine: functional and serves its purpose. (I did like the size of the bath towels, I must say.) But the free lotion/shampoo are stinky so bring your own! I do want them to pay more attention to the jacuzzis. They tend to get very icky. They need a regular cleaning/chemical treatment, ESPECIALLY as the summer season approaches. I found a band-aid floating in one of them...not cool, staff! All in all, I do recommend them. It's convenient to Rte 90 and smack dab in the middle of the OC. Nice ocean view, if you can get it (btw, that's NOT the feature I was asking for, just a higher floor). Free parking is nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with sodas that only cost 40 cents!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyMiss
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last 2 nights here with my husband on a business trip. We had a room off of a hallway that used to be an open walkway. Now the hall is enclosed, but the hall floor pitches quite noticeably toward the "outside wall". It gives one a distinct MOTEL feel. Once in the room, things got better. The kitchen was well appointed with old, but working, appliances. The small table and chairs were not up to Holiday Inn standards.The rest of the room was nice, as was the bathroom. The elevators were scary, and there was a profound odor of funky rain mats outside the main entrance. Parking was plentiful and convenient. I have to congratulate this hotel, as they have been very generous in keeping down the cost of the drinks in the vending machines! Only 40 cents. There was a sign in the lobby begging our pardon as they do some renovations. I am hoping they level the floors, replace the elevators, and work on that odor problem. After that, I would recommend this friendly, polite staff and its hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not too bad but don't expect to sleep in!”
Reviews.Author: Fredmac4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Ocean City area. I selected the Holiday Inn since I generally think of them as a value oriented, middle-of-the-road type of hotel. Even though it clearly experiences a high volume of beach traffic (with the associated wear and tear), it generally met our expectations in all but one important area - sleep quality. It fell far short in this area. Every morning at around 6:30am the wall between the bathroom and the bedroom area began making a loud 'ticking' noise. It sounded like thermal expansion from the pipes running through the walls but whatever the cause, it was extremely annoying. There was no sleeping in when this noise fired up. My whole family could hear it and I seriously doubt it somehow decided to rear its noisy head for the first time during our stay. I reported it to the front desk upon checking out thinking they might give me some consideration but the report was greeted with a courteous but firm "we'll look into it". I hate paying full price for less than a full price product so I won't be returning. There are too many options in the area to get an unwanted wake-up call every morning while on vacation...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ejkkck1
Reviews.Content: We had little options looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in OC, on the beach, in prime season just 45 days prior to our stay. As usual I used the reviews on tripadvisor and was a little concerned due to some of the negative reviews. However, our stay was great! The hotel honored our late check-in request (1am) - our room was clean and ready. Check in/out went without a hitch, concierge helped us find a great restaurant and the proximity to the beach was perfect. Swimming pool area with swim up bar and outdoor snack bar was very convenient - kids had a blast there and in the game room. I've already booked our room for June 2010 there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kmh51781
Reviews.Content: The holiday inn was great! I loved my room, i could see the ocean, the staff were very friendly and helpful! Will recommend!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lionsmkt
Reviews.Content: We have been to Ocean City many times and know of most of the accomodations but this was our first stay at the Holiday Inn on 66th st. We were not disappointed! The staff was very friendly and accomodating...the room was very clean and comfortable...the indoor pool was relaxing... and the restaurant was exceptional! In fact, we were so pleased that we stayed an extra night. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway and a Bargain Too”
Reviews.Author: 49erfan5
Reviews.Content: As part of my birthday celebration, I wanted to spend a couple days with a great ocean view. Since I am a member of Priority Rewards, I checked the rates at the Holiday Inn and couldn't believe my good fortune. Checkin was a breeze, the staff was very welcoming and I was handed a little welcome bag(as a free Priority Club member). The mini suite was spacious and clean with a full mini kitchen and microwave. I loved the pillows, but the tv and dvd player were great! We got Chinese takeout next door to Blockbuster and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant, chose some beautiful fresh fruit from the checkin area and enjoyed the rest of our day in our comfortable room with our spectacular view. I've already booked a return trip with he hope that the weather will be warm enough to enjoy our private balcony.

Reviews.Title: “I woudn't reccomend it.”
Reviews.Author: randomguy1988
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to say because my house coudn't withstand the snowstorm that hit my area. After going through insurance, I needed a place to stay. Most hotels could only let me stay for a few days, because it was the off season. But I was pointed to the Holiday Inn. Check in was less than desired. I got a room on the 7th floor, and I had to bring all my stuff up to my room myself. That did wonders on my back. But when I got settled in, I found the room was pretty nice, it had a good view of the ocean, and the beds where comfortable. I placed my order for breakfast and went to bed. I woke up realizing that breakfast never came, and that they didn't even get my order. I complained to the front desk, and left to eat elsewhere. Later that day my toilet was clogged... they made me do the unclogging. That night I placed my order for breakfast early and went to bed. Same thing happened, order didn't go through. I went and complained, and they directed me towards their restaurant. The food was actually pretty good. They also closed their pool for a day to contaminate it. Though having a horrible vision problem, I thought the sign was just labeling the indoor pool, just like the signs labeling all the other amenities. I was in there for about 10 minutes before somebody came to get me out. I guess that was my fault, though. I did have time to notice they had a jacuzzi or something like that. If you're on business and you need a high speed internet, their advertised high speed internet reminds me of the horrible days of dialup, minus the actual dialing. And before you ask, no, there's no wifi, unless you're on the ground floor. In your room, you need an Ethernet cable. They'll give you one at the front desk, but if you use a desktop PC or a gaming console, you'll probably have to go out and buy something long enough, there 4 foot chords don't cut it. There's also an HD TV... but as far as I can tell, all they have is basic cable, and a DVD player. So... what's the point? So to sum it up, this place feels more like a fully furnished 2 room apartment (including the bathroom as one room) than an actual hotel... until you look at the prices. I'm not recommending this place to anyone unless you have no where else to go.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sintax
Reviews.Content: wonderful restaurant in a romantic setting. Great seafood bar too. Bedding is superb.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the clean spacious room and the friendly courteous servious at the desk”
Reviews.Author: RandRLehighValleyPa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a couple of days off in January 2010 and went to Ocean City Md. Just to get away, drive out to the island to see the wild horses and do some shopping. We are glad we chose this hotel. Check in was smooth, the people at the desk were courteous. The room was a great deal in the off season, had a great view of the ocean, was clean and spacious. Though we ate out for our meals the room had a stove, frig, microwave, etc. We could have brought our own food and saved money. We had an excellent breakfast downstairs at restaurant: good food, great value and service. Of course a lot of places are closed down this time of year but there was enough opened for our intentions for the break. We shopped at the outlets, went over to Assateague island to see the horses, bundled up and walked the beach looking for shells for the grandkids, enjoyed the room, watched an old movie. Took a swim in the indoor (of course) pool. Although one guy took one ride on his surfboard. It was a great get away we are considering coming back with our kids and grandkids for an offseason vacation. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: jenlowery
Reviews.Content: A group of us recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Oceanfront and I would easily stay there again. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to go out of their way to acommodate us. The rooms were clean, the pool was great and the game room was fun. They have too many amenities not to love. Jenny Lowery

Reviews.Title: “The courteous, friendly manner of all the employees made my stay even better.”
Reviews.Author: cjvmfm
Reviews.Content: The fireplace in an ocean front room with snow on the sand was just beautiful. The employees could not have been more accomodating or friendly. The commom areas as well as my room room were spotlessly clean. I took advantage of the pool and gym and they were well kept also. I had one meal in the restaurant, Reflections, and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This is not really a 3.5 star hotel but it does have potential.”
Reviews.Author: CWipes
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Ocean City for 25 years, but this was my first time to Ocean City in January. I stayed here Jan 04th - 06th. Located on Costal Highway and 60th Street, ocean side. Each room has some kind of Ocean view. The room we were given was on the 7th floor, and was both non-smoking and came with 2 double beds as I had requested. The had an oddly placed kitchen table in the kitchenette which made entering and exiting the room quite cumbersome. I relocated the table and chairs to near the fireplace and that seemed to resolve the congestion. Check in was simple and the staff were courteous and helpful. There was a large bowl of free fruit (apples, oranges & bananas) next to the check-in desk. Can soda's from the soda machine were $0.40, something I had not seen in a very long time. There was a sign saying that they were putting a new face on an old place, or something like that as I entered the hotel. Yes, well, the hallways are hard and expensive to renovate, which I guess that's why they haven't. The rooms have been touched up. I'm guessing each room now has an LCD tv mounted over a fake fireplace in the corner of the room, it's a nice fake fireplace for the winter, but I think it would seem out of place in the summer. The bathroom looked and felt original. There was even a timer heat/sun tan light in it. I mean the bathroom worked fine, it just felt dated. Parking was plentiful and free in front of the hotel, but yes this is the off season for Ocean City. So the was parking available everywhere. Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant in the hotel, and I was given a discount coupon for it upon check-in, but the prices seemed a little high. I did visit the business center which was free, and did make use of the hottub in the pool area. The timer on the far hot tub was broken so if you set it to 10 minutes, the dial would remain on 10 minutes, even after 20 minutes. There is a common area video arcade with an unlimited coffee maker in the same room, on the Lobby floor. In all, this was a good stay. $0.40 can sodas! This does have the potential to be a 3.5 star hotel, but it's currently feels more like a 2.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel-Rooms Nice-Hallways Ugly and Smelly”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on business and I really like the quick check-in process. On my way to my first floor room, the white cinderblock hallway with old, smelly carpets did not give me a warm, fuzzy feeling. I thought I was walking through an old school dorm or a nursing home. The smell in the hallways was odd; a combination of feet, potato chips, and decaying flowers. Not very welcoming. The room was very clean and well-appointed. The only issue I had was the old, soiled chair that sat against the wall, oddly out of place. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious and my wake-up call was right on time. All-in-all, this hotel is not bad, but the hallways need some severe cleaning, nicer colors, and new carpeting.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Decent, Fantastic Area !”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for four nights in August on a "Freebee" with Holiday Inns most recent promotion. Therefore it is hard for me to really rate the true value of this property since it did not cost me anything to begin with. Howsoever, we had a very nice stay here overall. We visited during the busy time and therefore did not get their best room. It was still ok but it did have a subtle smell of mold and was a little cramped with two seven year olds. Other than that, it was an attractive hotel. The beach was great, although the surf was too rough for my kids sometimes. We never ate there as there are far too many restaurants close by with OUTSTANDING Food! The crab cakes are out of this world and I wish I could find them up here in the Boston Area. The outdoor pool was too crowded when we were there but my kids did like the indoor pool and shuffleboard etc. The staff was very helpfull, especially the concierge who was a sweetheart. If you are bringing children here I would definetaly recommend Jolly Rogers Water Park and Trimpers Amusement park as great entertainment values. We had great weather, friendly people, fantastic food and fun parks and beaches to go to. Truth be told, this turned out to be an excellent vacation for us and I am already contemplating a return trip next year ! There are many hotel options in this area and I would target price against location. Would I come back to this hotel if I had to pay a peak season rate? Probably not unless I could get a rate of $ 160 a night or less.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Ocean City is a Must Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CheerAunt
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to the Holiday Inn Ocean City MD for a 5 day relaxation vacation and that is exactly what we had! We had an ocean front efficiency - the room and the view were AMAZING! The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable! The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in (almost better than home!) I will definitely go back to this hotel the next time I'm in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “I will return!”
Reviews.Author: mlh981
Reviews.Content: As a return guest, my son and I went to the Holiday Inn for a few days and decided to go in September when it wasn't so hectic. The staff was nice and friendly, they helped me find local things to do with my son. I love how they have updated the rooms, they were well kept and that is very important to me. I also loved the new look of the lobby! I will definantly be returning to stay at the Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Remodel”
Reviews.Author: traveler4md
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was great and the location is good. However, the rooms were a huge disappointment. We moved after discovering mold and cigarette smoke in the first room. The second room had mold in the bathroom and large brownish red stains on the sheets, lampshades and drapes. This hotel desperately needs to be remodeled. We sent a letter to the management company and have yet to receive a response.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a good value”
Reviews.Author: Lauryc
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be clean and well appointed, with a full mini-kitchen. We loved the balcony with the cute bistro set... perfect place for our morning coffee. Our bed was very comfortalbe and the pillows and linens in perfect condition. The TV was a new flat panel and the fireplace was very nice. Our interaction with the staff was basically just check-in, but that was fine. There was a small amount of rust on some metal elements such as door hinges, to be expected in an oceanfront property. The outdoor areas were really nice. The pool was large and attractive with a swim-up bar, and you have your choice of hammocks or lounge chairs to enjoy the beach. Our room came with a great deal at the restaurant, so that was a plus, too. We were there after Labor Day, so there were few children and the place was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cheezzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Oceanfront for a little family "mini vacation". Chose this hotel as it was recommended by friends. Location of this hotel is great, nice quiet area close to the beach; kind of a central location to everything. Rooms were okay--kind of outdated but clean. Mini kitchen came in very handy--had full size refrigerator, stove, & dishwasher as well as coffeemaker. Indoor pool and hot tubs looked kind of scurvy--did not use them. Outdoor pool was okay but needed to be heated, very cold. Enjoyed the swim up bar, pool area was enjoyable. Housekeeping neglected us one day--call to front desk prompted night cleaning which was okay. Great views from the balcony. Overall our stay there was enjoyable and we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: KRB21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Delmarva Bike Week 2009. The room had a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher. The bed was extremely comfortable. It even had dishes and silverware. It isn't a new hotel, but I didn't think it was as run down as some others had stated. I guess it is all a matter of opinion. The room was fairly expensive, but just about everything in Ocean City is high during bike week. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected...”
Reviews.Author: MsIowa
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed in this hotel. It is very run down and seemed like someone had been in our room going through our stuff. The front desk was friendly and very helpful. It was really not worth the price we paid for it and won't be staying here again. We enjoyed our 10th Anniversary despite all of this.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this place”
Reviews.Author: beachm0m2
Reviews.Content: It was one of the most dirtest placest I have ever stayed in . The room smelled like wet clothes left in a washer. The floor wasnt vacumned. The curtains smelled worse than the bathroom. They only change sheets when asked. The hallways look like they have never been cleaned. It needs a total re-haul. The pool is disgusting. The game smelled like chemicals. DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY, we checked out early and couldnt wait to get a shower and washed all our clothes whether we wore them or not!! YUK YUK YUK

Reviews.Title: “good vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: jmegster
Reviews.Content: i read the reviews prior to leaving, however always formulate my own opinion. The resort is in a prime location. It offers easy access to the beach and not too far from the boardwalk. I arrived prior to the scheduled check in, the room wasnt ready, however, the clerk took my cell phone number and called me when my room was ready. The hotel has an indoor and outdoor pool. The outdoor pool on the weekend had a band playing, and the prices werent too bad for the drinks. It felt like a tropical vacation. The pool area also had sundecks with hammocks to just relax. The rooms weren't updated, but they were fine for a family looking to sleep at night. It offered a mini kitchen and a balcony. The staff was very helpful and polite. I will return to the Holiday Inn and would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RESERVE A ROOM THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPeteNewJersey
Reviews.Content: When we initially were running a seach on Trip Advisor the only negative review I read was that the Reception staff were not friendly, other than that the Hotel was great! WRONG INFORMATION! The staff STILL ARE DEFENTELY NOT FRIENDLY - and have no customer support skills whatsoever - BUT the Hotel was Bad bad bad as well NOT WORTH THE MONEY PAID at all. If you are a family with young KIDS - LOOK ELSE WHERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday Inn I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: pammommy
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is very nice and there's even a sign that says "Enjoy our new look!" as you walk in. Beautiful grand piano, new furniture, and fresh new wallpaper. The niceness stops there. Turn the corner and there are stains on the carpets and old paint. The entire hotel (except for the nice, new lobby, of course) looks like it had its last makeover in 1988. As you walk down the hall, you can actually see that the hallway/building is leaning to one side. The carpet inside the room was always damp, and there's this general damp/musty smell throughout the entire building. I normally enjoy returning to my hotel room after a long day out, but I dreaded coming back to this room because of the smell. We had trouble getting the internet to work in our room, but they were good about fixing the problem right away. The pools were a decent size and there were several, which was good. The tile/sharp pebbles on the pool deck could be replaced, though. There's a swim-up pool bar, (somewhat) nice game room, tennis/shuffleboard courts, and an area with several hammocks for relaxing on. It was in a excellent location for the beach and the Coastal Hwy. strip. There was plenty of parking on-site. The room was large, but sort of cramped: the kitchen area (with its 1970s-era counters/appliances) is right in your face as you walk in, along with a small dining set that you hope doesn't become a fire hazard should you need to escape. The bathroom was tiny and constantly damp, but functional. I'd stay again if nothing else or a worse hotel was the only one available, but the Holiday Inn at 17th Street is a much nicer place (we looked to transfer there after a few days, but they were booked).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: ebusby
Reviews.Content: I just spent the week at the Holiday Inn in Ocean City MD and thought it was great. Stayed with my two children and they both loved it. We loved the room and the balcony overlooking the beach and pool. Since it was August, it was very crowded, but it was not at all loud at night so that was not really a problem. The beds were really comfortable. Bathroom a bit small, but no big deal. I liked having a small kitchenette so we didn't have to go out for breakfast each day. The pool was a bit small, but not bad (nice swim up bar). It was great having the beach right there. We are Priority Club members and were staying on points and every night some one came to the room and asked if there was anything we needed, we had no problem with the service all week. Ate one night in the hotel restaurant - a bit expensive but good food. This was our first time at OC - liked it, but it it very crowded. Overall, the hotel was a very good choice and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: momof2prncs
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day/4 night stay. I've stayed at other places in O.C. but this time wanted to stay somewhere a little nicer. I read many reviews before choosing the Holiday Inn and after reading the reviews and seeing the pictures, I felt it was probably worth the money. Paying more money doesn't always mean nicer, $300/night. I made my reservation 6+ months ago and had some requests for the hotel. #1-early check-in, #2-ground floor, #3 room next to other family members staying in the hotel. Upon arrival we were told that there is no early check-in, and were given a room on the fifth floor. The pictures on the computer are very deceiving. The pool is very small and actually had missing tiles in areas-needs some fixing. There are only 3 washers and 2 dryers available for use by hotel guests-how can only this many washers and dryers accommodate all the guests they have! Hotel hallways had peanut shells on the floor for the entire 5 days we were there. The room was clean but not new and beautifully renovated and not what the pictures show on the computer. When I booked my reservation, the computer actually said that renovations were going to take place in early Spring 2009. The bathroom in the room was clean but had mold growing in the caulking on the floor around tub. I will return to O.C. but will not stay at the Holiday Inn again. I had just as nice of a room at the $200/night places I've stayed in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice but needs a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyG16148
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first ever trip to Ocean City. Here are some of my thoughts: 1) Rooms-Were nice but not overwhelming considering the price we paid. Full kitchen was a money saver with two young kids. Our refrigerator broke early in the week, but was quickly replaced by the staff. They even moved all of our drinks and food from the broken frig to the new one. The bathroom was too small.32 inch Flat screen TV was a nice surprise as were the variety of TV channels.Kids were entertained whenever we were in the room. Oceanfront view from patio was priceless. Beds were comfortable. Overall i'm glad we paid extra for the oceanfront view which allowed us privacy in the morning and at night sitting on the patio. 2)Pool-I'm guessing 30 years ago the pool complex was THE place to be in OC, but it is in much need of a makeover or just a good cleaning. The pool bar is a nice addition, but it created some rather uncomfortable scenes with young kids splashing and playing near adults enjoying a cocktail. The restaurant and the sundecks were very nice and the whole atmosphere with the hammocks and palm trees was very nice. The hotel needs to consider getting rid of the tennis court and attaching another pool in that area. Something geared towards kids. With very limited lounge chairs around the pool, it is impossible for parents with young kids to sit in the upper areas while having kids swim. More room is needed. Clean up the current pool/bar but adding more kid-friendly pool space would elevate this hotel. The tennis court is a big waste of space. Hundreds would use the pool on a daily basis, compared to 10 or 12 people a day using the tennis court. Also, really surprised the pool closed at 8 daily. We would have loved to sat by the pool later with the kids swimming. Not sure what the reason was? 3) Gym-used it once. Was average at best. One stationary bike was not working very well. 4) Business center-very nice to be able to go check my work email every morning on one of the two very fast computers. The printer that was available was also a bonus. Very nice. 5) Kids club-Only used it once for a cooking class. Seemed like a nice option but with my kids getting older it wasn't something they wanted to do. 6) Beach-Fantastic access, nice sand, no problems at all. 7) Parking-Lots of spaces in the big lot very close to the entrance 8) Elevators-never waited at all. Overall, the hotel was very nice. My family enjoyed our stay. No real complaints except for the outdated pool area. We paid extra for a oceanfront view, which was a great decision, but the overall price for the rooms were high, which has made us consider going a different direction next year. I do recommend this hotel with a warning that the hotel is outdated in some sections.

Reviews.Title: “Find an alternative”
Reviews.Author: bettertotravel
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels along this stretch of coast line don't choose this one! Yes its near to the beach but they all are! Our teenage kids loved the games room and free internet but the hotel reception and room smelt funny! The staff were indifferent and even got shirty when we requested new tennis balls cos the ones the gave us were broken! Beds were made but only the top sheet was straightened, they couldn't be bothered to straighten the lower sheet.- never had that before! Also only one net curtain across half the window so had to keep curtain closed as room faced a path. Room wasn't cleaned till 3pm one day. Minor moans in the scheme of things but contributed to the couldn't care less attitude that permeated the place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: denisekena
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is okay but you can see most of the indoor areas are in dire need of updating. The inside pool, hot tub and sauna areas are not worth visiting due to their condition. The rooms are clean and adequate but could also use a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation with kids”
Reviews.Author: LisaPQueens_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Altho not a pristine, perfect hotel was a wonderful place to spend a week with kids. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. The Concierge really knew her stuff! The kids activities were a big plus, time alone for parents!! The room was big and comfortable with a huge tv, fireplace and a balcony overlooking the beach. Full kitchen with dishwasher and plenty of utensils. The room was clean everyday. The pools were big enough and clean with plenty of towels. There was a bar at the outdoor pool but it wasn't intrusive or overly loud. The lobby always had a basket of fresh fruit available and there was a piano that no one got excited if your kids touched it a bit. Right outside was a grocery store and the bus stop which took you down to the boardwalk for $2 all day! Free parking too. The beach was right outside the hotel so there's no need to drive and park anywhere if you don't want to.

Reviews.Title: “WASTED MY TAX RETURN”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniaolivia
Reviews.Content: You must wear flip-flops around the pool. The in-laid pebbles in the concrete will rip the soles of your feet. It's a good thing I brought lots of band-aids. The swim-up bar is very nice, but I was amazed, as I sat sunning myself for 6 hours, I did not see any adults leave the swim-up bar to use the rest room. WOW, What magnificent bladder control !!!! ,If you wish to ride the bus to the boardwalk ,it's about 35 to 45 minutes,depending on all the stops. Rooms need updated, bathrooms look old, cleaning was sporatic. You need more outside spray stations to get the sand off, maybe then it won't be on the bottom of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in OC”
Reviews.Author: daneAm
Reviews.Content: I favor this hotel not only for cleanliness, wonderful customer service/staff and parking, but mainly for the gorgeous oceanfront views, balcony, beach access and safety. I always ask for peace and quiet, which is hard to get much of- after all it is a beachfront hotel- but the rooms I am given for my stays work out perfectly! It's my favorite place to relieve my stress!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AMA5874
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in the Holiday Inn Ocean City Maryland. I booked this trip 5 months in advance and got a wonderful room facing the ocean from the 4th floor. I can tell you it was the perfect view. We kept the door open a few nights to listen to the waves and yes we did hear them. When we arrived our room was available right away and there was bell service to take our bags up. The room was clean. If you don't want to stay on or by the Boardwalk this is the place for you. The pool was clean and we really loved the hamocks. We did not order any room service since there was a small efficiency kitchen. The only minus was the air conditioning seemed to make a very loud buzzing noise at night which was annoying. I would recommend this hotel and would stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a few days with my wife. We got a room on 5th floor that looked out to the beach directly- the view was absolutely amazing! The staff was generally friendly although the front desk crew tended to overdo it both ways, They were either aloof or too chatty. They were always polite and helpful though. The hotel looked clean and neat, we could tell the hallway carpets were new or almost new. We loved the outdoor pool, it was a little small but it didn't bother us. We could get some sun, get a drink and even something to eat. The room was really nice and it got cleaned every day. We were very impressed by our housekeeper- a young lady from Poland, she was professional and thorough. It was a pleasure to talk to her every day as she took care of our room, she seemed intelligent and had an elegant way about her that my wife found very endearing and ladylike. She always found time to answer our questions, even when it was obvious that she was busy and tired, she had a bright smile on her face. We asked her about local restaurants and clubs and found her recommendations very helpful. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay in Ocean City. The weather wasn't too good, it rained a lot, but there were plenty of things to do other than frying on the beach. We will certainly come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl38
Reviews.Content: We planned a last-minute trip to Ocean City. Of course, it was too late to get a room on the Boardwalk so for the first time I chose a hotel up the road -- this one. It turned out to be fairly easy to "commute" to the big parking lot on the inlet by the boardwalk and rides. And it turns out you get a lot more for your money if you get off the Boardwalk some. This is a remodeled old Holiday Inn. The rooms and lobby have been redone and seem new. Parts of the hotel, such as the indoor pool area, look more dated, but that is not a problem for me. Service is unreal, even compared to four-star hotels I stay at for business sometimes. I got a call about an hour after settling into my room asking if everything was OK. The room had a minor maintenance issue and it was taken care of promptly. The manager has his home phone number in the hotel information notebook and says to call if any problem is not resolved. I received a thank you note after I returned home. Great restaurant recommendations and other helpful info from the front desk staff. We had breakfast a couple of times in the restaurant, and it was fine. Same with lunch at the fun pool bar. A professional clown was present in the lobby during the days we were there to make balloon animals for the kids and have other fun -- the kids loved that. We made good use of the fun indoor pool during some cool days -- there are two hot tubs and a sauna in the same area. It is also nice they have soda machines dispensing 40-cent 12-ounce cans of soda. Hotels tend to gouge you there, I find. There are fancier hotels but for what this is I think they do a superb job. My kids never say much about the quality of hotels we stay at but they both volunteered that "this is a great hotel." I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay & Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julesism
Reviews.Content: We planned a beach trip after a couple days visiting our son in Baltimore. We had a nice scenic 3 hour drive to the Holiday Inn from Baltimore. We arrived around 2pm and were quickly and ploitely checked in. We did the $20 deposit to get the cord that allowed for internet access with our pc. Internet worked great from our from off our pc. Our room was clean and cozy, with a nice king bed that had a soft down-like comforter. Plenty of pillows and clean damask type sheets. Off to the right was a small kitchen with all utensils and a fridge, dishwasher, stove, microwave, and coffee pot. To the left was a small sitting area with a great flatscreen TV and pullout sofabed, and off that area was the balcony. Great eastern shore view. We could hear the sounds of peaceful waves and the views were even nicer. The bathroom was compact, but clean, recently remodeled, and full of plush towels and two kinds of soap, lotions, and shampoo. Good working wall mounted blow drier made the restroom facilities complete. We dined at the hotels restaurants three times. Once for a very good breakfast and twice for an outstanding dinner meal. I highly recommend their dining options. All food was GREAT, a tad pricey, but worth it. Pool area was alittle small, but a HUGE clean and wonderful beach is right outside your door, so we mostly did the beach. The ocean swimming was cold, but lots of fun. We really enjoyed Ocean City and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! A wonderful hotel...felt like a 5 Star to us!!!”
Reviews.Author: familytravelesr6
Reviews.Content: Wow, Holiday Inn of Ocean City, Md at 66th street ocean side was WONDERFUL, The desk staff were all great and friendly and they were the only hotel when i called that I truly felt like I was getting the answers I wanted and needed. The guy on the phone told me I should request a room with the 32" TV's I was like WOW that is cool...he had said there was a FULL kitchenette, There was and it was great, I didn't use it like I should've, It would've saved us much more money if I was more prepared etc. There was gas fireplace below our flat screen. HOW ROMANTIC (our 4 little guys ages 6,3,2 and 10 months all liked it too:):):) ha ha lol..... the really nice thing with having four littles here was that we could watch tv and we had a HUGE, thick curtain in between us where the tv was and it separated where the 2 beds were. There was a love seat and another comfy chair and we had gorgeous views of the ocean and we had requested the 6th floor i think it was and it was WONDERFUL. The place was clean, nice, updated and just amazing for a young family on a budget. I can't wait to go back next year. Hmmm maybe even this fall. The only thing that we would've liked would' have been to be right on the board walk but the guy on the phone warned me that with little kids he would stay further up and stay away from sleeping that close to all the partying that would be happening since it was "Cruising" Weekend at O.C. I am so glad we took his advice there was drunk people all over the place hanging out windows and on the front of the porches of the hotels SCREAMING at the car's and hey it was fun to watch the people and the cars but I would've been very upset if there loud behavior would've kept my little guys all weekend. So we made the right choice. Well God Bless you as you figure out where to stay. This is my first review on anything and I just want to say again the place was sooooooooo nice.. And the pool was AWESOME and it is open until 12 midnight which is sweet. (indoor pool that is) they had an outdoor pool with a bar but that wasn't filled yet. They have a very nice game room, ummm oh and the USA Today get's delivered to your door step EVERYMORNING!!! man that was cool. And Well it was just GREAT. You gotta check it out. And the food in the restaraunt below was nice (i ordered it and went and picked it up a yummy crab cake sandwich) WONDERFUL. I have a good sense of style and decor and this place was great!!! Blessings, Shannon From Pa

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: dipseydo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to OC for the weekend and decided on HI ocean front. We booked a king size room direct ocean front and are very pleased. We aren't the type to spend all our time at the hotel but it is a great location right off the expressway bridge. Plenty of great restaurants to explore (especially liquid assets). A Worlds Gym is across the street and offers day passes. The outdoor pool caters to a younger crowd and has a pool bar and band during the day. We stayed directly on the ocean in the X01-X02-X03 rooms (x=floor #). These are the best located rooms in the hotel. The X01 rooms not only have a balconey but a side window that views down south and the pool bar. Lots of fun. It is not a 5 star, but the room was very clean, had a kitchenette, and a decent bathroom. If you want the beach, sun, fun at a good price this is the hotel for you. The common area's have a short ceiling (probably less than 7 feet). We love the room, location and left the door open at night falling asleep to the sound of the ocean. It doesn't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise--I'd love to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: businessmommie
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to be the keynote for a youth conference and decided to stay at the hotel for convienence sake. FIRST IMPRESSION: Upon my arrival, I found a beautifully updated lobby and staff proud to showcase it. This is a hotel that is under renovations and the lobby and guest rooms are complete ( I would say that is the most important part!!). What remains is to update the carpeting and wall design for the hallways and the lobby provides a sneak peak into how they will appear once complete. GUEST ACCOMODATIONS: The first room I was given was HUGE and from what I understand they are all the same size with small kitchens, flat screen televisions, clean updated bathrooms and comfortable beds. The rooms all feature a sitting area near the television with a balcony. If there was one drawback to room placement it would be the distance from the bed to the television...But the quality of the televsion compensated for that as it was easy to view from a distance. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I contacted Ryan at the front desk because the area I was in was a bit noisy with all the children from the conference I was there to participate in. He called me back within 2 minutes and arrived a short time later to escort me to a more upgraded room in a quieter part of the hotel...and for the same conference rate!! My new room was quiet and tucked away with a balcony that stepped out directly onto the beach. INTERNET ACCESS: The rooms do not have wi-fi, so I recommend bringing your hard connections (cat 5) to use the internet on laptops. However the connection is close to the kitchen bedroom area, where a small table functions perfectly as a desk area. ADDITIONAL AMENITIES: Did I also mention that this hotel has a FREE business center that includes 2 desktops and a printer?! For business travelers that need to print a few things on the go, it is perfect. The printer is not a laser, but an HP multifunction that can get the job done. This hotel also has a game room with arcade games, an indoor heated pool and jacuzzi area and a fitness area on the bottom level. FRONT DESK STAFF: Both Destiny and Natasha at the front desk were DELIGHTFULLY nice and helpful when helping with good places to eat. Without prompted, when they saw me leaving in the evenings they would ask "Are you on your way to get something to eat?" And then the suggestions followed. I had an insanely great rate from the conference, so good I decided to stay for the weekend...Thanks Holiday Inn Ocean City...you have made a fan out of me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JL007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HI in Aug. 07. He had stayed there previously and I was not disappointed. It is a HI so it is not the Ritz, but the rooms were clean and the hotel staff was friendly. Our first night, they put us on a bottom floor room (we had booked an ocean view room). So we did not have a good view. They did move us the next day when there was more availability. After they moved us to a different floor, the rest of the vacation was perfect. It was a matter of being patient since it was their peak season. I loved the jacuzzi and indoor pool as well as the outdoor pool with the little cabana cafe next to the ocean. The hotel is literally steps from the ocean water. That was the best part of the whole vacation. We would go to the beach in the mornings, come back around 2pm for lunch (we got stuff at the store and stuck it in the frig). Would relax for a couple hours, walk around, drive somewhere, and then go to dinner later on in the day. We were there for a full week and thought the hotel was also centrally located to everything. Parking was also not an issue and they gave us a pass for our car. I would recommend this location and hotel to anyone! My girlfriends and I were going to stay here for my bachelorette party, but it was booked that weekend :) We'll be back once we move back to the East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jrdemsko
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel first had no personnality. On the way to the room i noticed how dirty the elevator was and the hallways. Carpets were worn. Stayed in room 702 on the oceanfront so I paid top dollar. There were four of us, my wife two kids and I. First I noticed how small the room was. The two double beds were stuffied in the small area. There was a tiny table with two chairs in the kitchenette area. The room had a mildew smell. First thing i notice when puting the suitcases on the bed was the filty black AC vent that used to be white. My wife has asma so dust and dirt don't go over well. I went out in the hallway where there were 3 house keeping people. Took some time for me to explain to them that i wanted them to clean that vent. Most of the worker in the Hotel come here for the summer to work from Eastern Europe. Later that day after coming back from the Beach we noticed how much mold was in the bathroom tub area outside and in. Complained to front desk, they sent someone to clean it. AC was nosiey. they never fixed that. This place runined our vacation. i will never ever stay here or anyother holiday inn again. You may say don't compare all H.I.with this one, but I complained on the survey that was sent to me a week later and also on the Holiday Inn website and no response. Even the front desk at this Hotel never said they were sorry. I can't tell how much anyone with a family should not ever waste their money staying at this dump!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Tomchichi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn during the second week of September, which was also the start of Bike Week 2008. We aren't Bikers but we wanted to go on a last minute vacation and we decided on Ocean City. The Hotel: When you are driving down Coastal Highway you get to 65th street and you see the hotel and the outside looks great. Grounds are clean, landscaped, and you breath a sigh of relief that you are at a nice place. Lobby: Very clean and a very friendly staff was waiting. Check in is 3:00pm and we got there about 4:30pm so we were in and out. I got a nice little welcome bag and we ready to go to our room. The Lobby also is where you enter the Hotels 2 restaurants. More on them later. Elevators: There were 3 elevators that worked fast, and had a nice open view of the Bay as you went up. Hall Way: We stayed in the East Wing Ocean Front on the 6th floor. Got out of the elevator to this strong smell of Lysol. The Hallway was the worst part of the Hotel. The rug was dingy and the smell of Lysol just was to much. Room: We opened our room to find an overall nice room for the money we paid. 2 double beds with lots of pillows, Sofa that turns into a bed, a whole kitchen (Oven, toaster, fridge, sink, and pots and pans, utensels, dishwasher) Very nice private balcony overlooking the beautiful Atlantic Ocean. The bathroom was small but as my wife said ("it works). Overall the room was spacious and clean and that is what is important. I'm at the Ocean I'm not hanging out in my room, but if we had to the room was nice Hotel Ammenties Out door pool is very nice, lots of chairs to sit, and has a swim up bar. Bar is reasonably priced. There is also an outdoor bar/restuarant. There is a nice Tennis court (not sure if the hotel provided equipment) Also a nice place above the pool where they have hammocks set up. We took advantage of that. Game Room and workout room that has a tanning bed. My wife used the tanning bed in the morning and says it is great. She used it to hide those tan lines! LOL! Indoor pool, hot tub, and sauna. Indoor pool is shallow and was more busy then the outdoor pool. The indoor pool has towels for guests. Sauna worked very well. There are 2 hot tubs. The first one you come to doesn't work and hasn't but it does have nice hot water. The second one is awesome. Only drawback to the Indoor Pool area is the ceiling is rusty and they tile needs to be grouted. Basic up keep needs to be done. Location: for us it was perfect we were about 5 minutes North of the Boardwalk and Inlet where all the Bikers were. Plenty of shops and restuarants in walking distance. If you want to be closer to the boardwalk then I would try the other Holiday Inn. Restuarants/Shops: Acrross from the hotel we found was the best gift shop and a nice litte wine store. Also a great resturant called Castaways. I 100% recomend Castaways to anyone. We also ate ate at Doughboys which is a chain that is a step up from a Diner, but overall not bad. I have to give a shoutout to Paisano's on the boardwalk. Best Pizza on the Boardwalk! Give them try.l Overall the Holiday Inn was a nice place for my wife and I to stay at. We liked it so much we will be coming back in 2009 during Bike week. Bike week is cool for a few reasons. Its not peak season so the prices go down, but all the atttractions are still open. Plus these bikers are crazy and makes for some interesting entertainment, not to mention all the beautiful Bikes to look at. Thanks for a great stay Holiday Inn Tom and Kelly Cohoes New Yori

Reviews.Title: “Not what anyone would want for their family”
Reviews.Author: elc3093
Reviews.Content: We checked in fine, the outside is prabably the best it has going for it in terms of looks and conditions. Staff was rude, not friendly, and not helpful. Hallways, elevators, lobby and pool area was plain dirty. THere is no other way to discripe it. We saw a huge stain on the floor as you got off the elevators, we saw several staff personnel go by several times a day, and at the end of the day, it was still there, even after the cleaning staff went by. Rooms are old, the is a constant musty odor everywhere, even in the outdoor pool area. Pool was ok, and the staff at the pool bar and grill were nice. General Hotel staff and housekeeping did not even speak english. We requested a non smoking roon, got the wrong room, had to sleep with the balcony door open, and the screens were all ripped up, like some pet had gotten at them a long time ago. Beds had sunken parts in the middle, and sofa's were smelly, filthy, and worn away. This place needs a major over haul, and the staff needs to take a customer service training couse. This is what a hotel and its staff and managers do, they serve customers, if that is not the purpose , then they should just shut it down. Horrible operation. Do not bother, not too mention that thye charge top rate for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude - no customer service!”
Reviews.Author: happyboater
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying we had a great time despite the problems and the smells. The front desk staff is extremely rude. Our room was not ready as promised. We had called early when we were an hour away and were assured that the room would be ready - it of course wasn't. They tried to give a room with a different view - with no price break - so we decided to wait - and wait we did. (The reason we called first was so we wouldn't be waiting, since I saw that people had problems) There was no sorry, just a surly attitude - so as we were waiting and waiting -- in the parking lot we saw a car with its window smashed. We told them there was a car with the window broken and asked if there is any type of security for the parking lots - all she said was hmm.. thats the first I heard of the broken window - but we're not responsible for your car. Just plain rude. We made sure to park in the front lot - not the side one. The hotel has an awful stale odor - a mix between a dog kennel and dead fish. The first elevator we got in was not working and hesitated a few times before the doors finally opened to let us out. Needless to say we used the stairs. We kept hearing the alarm. Once in the room - I will say that view was nice, but the room was hot and muggy. The tile floor - right when you walk in was damp & I almost killed myself when I slipped - and I was wearing boat shoes! Air conditioning was barely working - but at least we could open the door to try to air the place out. The room was also so smelly and run down. The bathroom is old and run down - the carpeting is stained and dirty - I didn't even dare sit on the couch. Walking around outside - what I ended up calling the ashtray -the place is covered in cigarette butts - but walking between the rooms and the pool - it even smelled bad outside - but more like urine! When we made it up to our room one morning after walking on the beach (which is nice - at least you can escape to the beach) our room cards would not open our room. So back downstairs to the rude front desk clerk. She barely said anything, called the maintenance guys and handed us new keys & said maybe these will work - it was like she thought she was going out of her way. The maintenance people were at least friendly and helpful, perhaps they should man the front desk. We travel a lot and normally I wouldn't complain, but the attitude and overall condition of the hotel was so appalling, I have never been treated more rudely. I know it's a Holiday Inn beach hotel - so we weren't expecting much - but I don't think we were expecting too much hoping to be treated in a friendly (even somewhat friendly would have been fine) manner and stay in a place with working air conditioning that doesn't smell foul. This place needs a lot of work and is severely lacking in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a View”
Reviews.Author: caam04
Reviews.Content: We booked a "garden view" room via the Holiday Inn website. We've stayed at this hotel in the past and were pleased enough although there are so many properties to choose from in Ocean City now that a hotel has to really "wow" me to earn my repeat business. There are few things about this hotel that make it stand out - the rooms accommodate five people comfortably (in our case it was 3 adults and 2 children) and the pool bar can't be beat! We did, however, pay the price when arriving as a late check-in as our "garden view" room ended up being 1 of 2 rooms that had no view whatsoever, except of a side street with some majorly inconsiderate people outside. We got a first floor room and while the view left more than a little to be desired the location was actually convenient - out the door, hang a left and in about 5 steps you were at the door heading to the pool and beach. The room was adequate, nothing fancy but we were comfortable. Free wi-fi is nice too! We'll likely return but will pay for an ocean front room!

Reviews.Title: “No customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cmt123
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 11 and was told room was not ready. Returned at 2PM and room was still not ready. I decided to sit in the lobby and wait for my room to witness everyone else arriving after me receive their room keys. Finally at 3:15, I was given room keys. Upon entering the room I noticed that the bathroom trash was full and the toilet area had a strong smell like Urine. Called the Front Desk and they transfered me to Housekeeping manager. His excuse was that maybe somebody had checked into this room and then changed the room. (Awful as I thought that rooms were checked after any guest enters the room). They sent a room attendant to clean the bathroom but the smell never went away. Was not offered to switch rooms or compensation. The pool is nice and so is the beach. However, public bathrooms are dirty. Will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Hotel, Nice Value in Relative Terms”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: Must admit that I was leery about staying at a Holiday Inn, as I am a loyal Hilton fan. The Hilton was $400+ and AAA had the HI at $229 a night. It was definitely worth it! The Good: great outdoor pool!; nice indoor pool too; swim-up bar is excellent; great band was playing on the weekend; great hammock/tanning area; beach is a walk out but is not a big deal (hotel is oceanfront); very helpful and pleasant staff The Medium: room was nice and was clean - it's a beach hotel and it met those expectations; room had a nice balcony to sip coffee and read the paper in the morning I recommend this hotel to families, singles, and pretty much all. Walk out your front door and cross the street to take the $2 bus down to the boardwalk for the tourist experience if you need it. This hotel provided the perfect bridge of everything - from my twelve year old daughter in the pool/arcade to the swim up bar/band for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Had an Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: alstewartfan2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Oceanfront for the first time. This is our 5th year going to Ocean City MD and the place we always stayed at has gone downhill so we thought we'd give this a try. We were not disappointed. Our room was directly on the oceanfront with a nice size balcony with 2 chairs and a table. Our room was very clean and the bathroom and kitchen were spotless. The bed (there were 2 beds plus a fold-out couch) was extremely confortable. The staff was friendly and courteous. The pool was a nice size and very clean with palm trees and hammocks. It felt like we were in Jamaica again! The rooms were quite soundproof. We had families with kids staying on either side of us and we could not hear them at all. That was a real plus because our son is grown and could not come with us because he was working so this was a very romantic trip! We will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: viajerasinrumbo
Reviews.Content: We are frequent users of the HI and a member of their Priority Club, My family had been planning this vacation for months and we had been trying to narrow down our choices between the Hilton and the two HIs. Since we are familiar on how the HI operates it won over the Hilton. BIG MISTAKE! First , staff at front desk is rude and could care less about taking care of customers, Second, we have priority check in, HA! non existent here! third, the pool bar was selling alcohol descriminatorilly, I swear I could easily have bought my daughter a drink and nobody would have had noticed! fourth , the beds were hard and uncomfortable and so were the pillows. We have stayed at other HI as mentioned before but at this hotel ouch so beware! On one of the nights someone above our room was moving furniture all night long, I am a light sleeper , so I was drifting in and out of sleep, I mentioned it to someone at the front desk the next morning and to see if the would at least gives us a small break and what she said was that if it happens again tonight call us and we will go and tell them to stop!! no apology ! nothing... on the day of check out even thinking that we have given them more than a grand , my husband said thank you to they clerk that checked us out TWICE all she did was IGNORED HIM so he said it again , and once again she totally IGNORED HIM. So sad! HI so sad , next time we are thinking of going down the road to the Hilton. More money, but when you go to vacation You expect to be taken care of and we did not feel that way tthis place. The view is beautiful , But overall , We will not be coming back here . neither will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: robbiev
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Ocean City MD Holiday Inn Oceanfront (67th St) We have to say we really enjoyed our stay. Although the Hotel is a little outdated overall it was pretty nice. Rooms were cleaned every day. We ate at the hotel resturants 2 nights and the food was absolutely great. The staff is very friendly except for the carpet shampoo gentlemen. He was shampooing the rugs to the right of the front desk and was hidden around the corner so you could not see him as I entered the hallway. He got real ennoyed and made a comment to me when I turned the corner and was walking on his cleaned carpet. I just laughed it off and told him to put a sign up or something next time. Kind of what I would expect from a minimum wage worker. The one main problem I had was really with some of the other guests. By 7am people would be putting there towels on the chairs around the pool to save them and then would not come back for hours. The pool does not actually open till 10 am but people were going into the pool as the pool girl was trying to clean it. The swim up bar and bartenders were absolutely wonderful. The food at the outside snack bar was perfect. We ate lunch there everyday. Overall I would come back to the Holiday Inn but probably off season. I thought it was a little pricey. Great location away from the boardwalk so the crowd is more family friendly. The boardwalk area seemed more of a younger crowd who was just looking to party all night (Like I did 15 years ago.lol.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pronto
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Ocean City last week and we had a great time! I loved the area and even though we got badly sunburned it was a great trip overall. The hotel was clean, well located, efficiently run and quiet. The room was adequate for our family (two adults and two teenagers). We loved the beach and grounds, the views from our balcony were beautiful. We ate in the hotel for the breakfast buffet and it was good. We would definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready for 3:00 check-in, pro-rated rate denied”
Reviews.Author: Gatos47
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation months in advance, as we were vacationing with relatives and wanted adjacent/ adjoining rooms. Arrived early (2:15), were told room was not ready early, so went to grocery store and returned at 3:20. We were told the room was still not ready, and could not tell us when it would be ready. I asked if we would receive a discount or pro-rated rate for that evening. We were denied this and told, "rooms are not guaranteed." Finally at 3:45 we had to take another room because our refrigerated and frozen foods would spoil in the warm car. This room was not adjacent to our relatives and had a less desireable view, but was the same price. The envelope in the room for the maids' tip states, " We clean check-outs first, so they are ready for 3:00 check-in." Although the room was very clean and comfortable, we will stay somewhere else next time so that we can check in at check-in time when we start paying.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mauidreemn
Reviews.Content: We booked the direct oceanfront room for one night as our last night in Maryland. Check in was smooth and people were friendly. That is about the only positive comments I have about this hotel. The hotel is in poor shape. It is dirty and outdated. The carpets in the rooms and hallway smell and are dirty. The room had old appliances and furniture. The moldy smell bothered my whole family. The bathroom was small and in run-down condition. The elevators are old and a little scary! The whole place just made you feel unclean. I am not a picky person at all. This hotel is just horrible. We will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'm definetly going back!”
Reviews.Author: shannylovespink
Reviews.Content: I just got back today from my wonderful vacation in Ocean City. This was the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at in Ocean City and the price isn't all that bad. The pool was really nice, I really enjoyed the atmosphere, the music, the trees and flowers all around, the hammocks, everything was great. The swim up bar was great. We got our use out of that. The drinks were a little pricey, so I'd advise keeping some cool drinks up in your room for when you're really thirsty. The room was VERY clean. I actually felt comfortable in it. The carpet could be replaced thouhg. But the furniture was pretty new. The bed was SO comfortable. I loved it. The shower had an adjustable showerhead AND good water pressure, which was nice. A lot of hotels dont have great water pressure. The balcony was large and had a little table and 2 chairs, which was nice. We ate breakfast out there a few times. We didn't get direct oceanfront, to save money, but it was just at good. Just take a slight glance to your left and there is the ocean. The kitchen was small but had a full size refrigerator and a dishwasher (big plus). About the review before mine, the curtains were maroon, so even if there was blood on them, you wouldn't have seen it. I noticed that the staff at this hotel keeps everything very clean, yes the hotel is a little dated in some aspects, but overall it's in great shape. I think perhaps that last review was made up for attention. I really dont see a hotel putting people in a room with bulletholes and blood all over the place, I would think the police would have been called and the place would have been cleaned up.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: philliesfan5
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend decided to suprise me with a 2 night stay down ocean city maryland for my birthday. She got a 1st floor ocean front view right on the beach at this location. Once i first walked in and saw the view i thought it was going to be amazing. The view was outstanding but the room threw it off a little bit. There was blood on the curtains. Im not talking about a lil spot of blood but what looked to be a mass murder on the curtain. There were what looked to be around 15 small .22 caliver bullet holes in the fridge as well. I didnt think about mentioning it to front desk until after we left. I would never stay in a Holiday Inn again after experiencing that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will be back”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinWendy
Reviews.Content: We took a week off for our kid's Easter Break from school. We were planning to go to Washington, DC but decided on a calmer relaxing vacation at the ocean. Although the weather was cold during the beginning of our stay, we had a great time, no crowds, little traffic, and our room was very nice. Our kids, 6 and 10, enjoyed the pool, ( I liked the hot tubs), the game room and we saved a bundle on meals by cooking in. I loved the fact that we had a large refridgerator, stove and microwave. Our view was fantastic, and our room was very clean. For the Price, was a fantastic deal, friendly and helpful staff, we will be back. (We did a day trip to DC, only 2 1/2 hour drive) Ocean City in the off-season is very relaxing and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: cincygirl2010
Reviews.Content: Three of my friends and I just returned from spring break. We stayed at this Holiday Inn during our stay. It is inexpensive and the quality of the hotel is excellent. The rooms were clean and large enough for four young adults to enjoy. The view off the balconies were amazing. We didn't order a beach side view but could see the beach regardless. The kitchen has everything that is needed to make a dinner except for mixing bowls. The best of the day were the staff. There was a slight incident with the guests next door being too loud/violent. The Holiday Inn staff evicted the guests the next morning. Do to us being young girls we did not feel comfortable staying in the room over night so two male managers escorted us to a different room with a better view for the rest of our stay. They even gave us free breakfast in their hotel restaurant. The restaurant was nice, good food, and reasonable prices. The staff know how to treat their guests really well. The pool was nice. Pool towels are provided by the hotel. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: nik30j
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Ocean City for a weekend getaway. After 2 unsuccessful tries at other hotels (1 was filthy, the other couldn't even tell us if they had vacancies because their computers were down!), we tried the Holiday Inn. The lobby was well-decorated & welcoming. The front desk staff were friendly & helpful, & let us go see the room before checking in. Both my husband & I were very impressed! The room had a nice bathroom, kitchennette, double beds, TV, romantic gas fireplace, & a balcony with a stunning oceanfront view. We were thrilled with the room. We tried the in-hotel restaurant, Reflections. There are actually 2 restaurants there; a casual, family dining restaurant, & Reflections, which is fine dining/French-American cuisine. It was 1 of the best meals we've ever had. The atmosphere was so romantic, & subdued (but, we got there just in time--6 pm; by 7 pm it was getting too loud, with too many people), with great service & the most delicious food. They have the BEST crab cakes I've ever had! Overall, this was a wonderful experience & made for a great weekend. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: happybeachgirl11
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for the last 2 summers for 4 nights in June with my girlfriends. This hotel could use some updating, but overall we found our room to be clean and it is nice to have a small kitchen area with fridge and microwave. The view is great. It is oceanfront and has a very nice pool bar and cafe to eat lunch. The location on 66th st is perfect. We will most likely be staying there again this year. I do wish they would update the elevator as it was a little scary at times!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine (but not wonderful)”
Reviews.Author: iwannatravel
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with a bunch of kids for a middle school conference. The room was on the larger side with two double beds and a fold out couch. There was a kitchen area with all the utensils and plates and such. It seemed clean enough. Needed updating and fixing up a bit. You could open your hotel door and look through the big windows out to the right and see the beach/ocean. The kids really liked the game room with the video games and pool table. There was also an indoor pool with 2 hot tubs, but the chlorine was overwhelming and there was also a gnat problem. Yuck! Other than that, everything was fine. The restaurant area always smelled delicious in the evenings (french restaurant, Reflections.) Not sure if I would stay here again because there are so many other nice hotels in Ocean city, especially ones with free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience !!”
Reviews.Author: oldfussbudget
Reviews.Content: A great three day, two night stay for six adults. The hotel was excellent and the restaurants were much better than any of us expected. The rooms were good size and clean. The Reflections restaurant was excellent for dinner. They prepared our meals (twin filets for 5 and a seafood pasta with cream sauce for me) at our table. The preparation, presentation and skill of the server was excellent. The meals were all served as requested, with fresh vegetables and hot honey poppy seed rolls that were to die for!!! Breakfast the next morning was full service and comparable to dinner the night before. Since this is off season the cost was unbelievable CHEAP!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “The HORROR at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: jodialex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in previous years with no problems. It has never been the most cleanest or new Holiday Inn I have stayed in, but has always been exceptable considering the price. Unfortunately this year the conditions are much worse. So bad that I wanted to leave. We almost did not have a room that had been reserved for a year prior, and when we got to the room it had obviously not even cleaned. Hair in the bathroom and a filthy bathroom floor, a visibly dirty kitchen area. Carpeting that had not been vacuumed and a horrible gnat problem. In my opinion this hotel needs to be cleaned and updated or use some TNT and start new. I do not recommend staying here unless you come armed with disinfectants and a high tolerance to substandard conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views- Holiday Inn Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: collapserelax
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have a brief getaway, and we have had several trips to Ocean City, and love the area. It was short notice, and almost every accomodation that I read on trip advisor, that sounded nice, was booked, because of BIKE WEEK, and the Dover races. However, I did look at all of the reviews, and finally came up with this one. We were a little leary of going because of all the traffic and noise from the bikers, but, it was not that bad. The rooms faced the ocean and you could not hear the street traffic. The room was small with 2 double beds, but very clean, the bathroom was spotless and there were plenty of clean white fresh towels. The sliding door opened up to a nice little balcony which provided a southern view of the ocean which was just as nice as the folks who were facing the ocean and paying more! It even had a decorative fireplace! Also when you left your room ,the inside corridor had huge windows which gave you a beautiful northern view of the ocean, the city ,and the bay! I would wake up and open the door and see the sunrise as I walked down the back stairs to an easy beach access, and pool access. There was a lovely tropical landscaped pool area, with a wade up bar, a sunning area w/sand and chairs and several hammocks to use. The staff was very helpful, and quick to resolve any problems or questions you had. The maid service was excellent. The area was on 66th street away from the congested activity at the end of the boardwalk. You could take the bus down to the boardwalk if you wanted to spend some time there without having to worry where to park (advice from the front desk). The Ocean City beaches are wonderful, they are very wide and have lovely soft sand. We were very pleased with our stay, and wished we could've stayed longer. No offense to the bikers, but if you are looking for a peaceful visit, and cannot tolerate a lot of noise-don't plan to come during Bike Week!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn at 66th Street, Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: barbara1561
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Holiday Inn at 66th Street in Ocean City, Maryland. We loved this hotel.
