It was directly on the ocean with an indoor pool, outdoor pool, swim up bar, three restaurants, gameroom, exercise room, tennis courts and shuffleboard. Really everything you could ask for. It also had two restaurants indoors and a nice poolside restaurant outdoors. There was also a swim up bar at the pool which we made good use of! Even the kids enjoyed swimming up to order Shirley Temples. We didn't get a chance to eat at the fancy restaurant (Reflections) but we did eat at the other two and the food was very good. The best part was that our three kids ate for free! There was also a full kitchen in the room which saved us some money making breakfast, lunch and snacks when we felt like it. The hotel itself is not brand new but it was clean and the front desk was very helpful and polite. We had a direct oceanfront room with a balcony, 2 double beds and a pull out couch. Plenty of room for two adults and three kids. There was also a nice flat screen t.v. with a dvd player. We definitely enjoyed our stay and would stay again. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying ay Holiday Inn Ocean Front”
Reviews.Author: Calcuttan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Ocean Front Ocean City at 6600 Coastal Highway and 66th Street. This is different hotel from the one on the boardwalk. We checked in on August 10, 2007 and checked out on August 12, 2007. We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 children, one 12 and one 6). We had asked for a non-smoking ocean front room and we got a very nice room on the 4 floor of the 8 storey building facing the ocean overlooking the outdoor pool and the tennis courts. While the check-in time is 3:00 PM, we arrived at 2:00 PM and had to wait for a room. In the meantime we were free to use both the outdoor and indoor swimming pools. We got a room at 2:30 PM. The room was of reasonable size with a large balcony, clean with a small fully stocked kitchen with oven, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, plates and cookware. We were provided discount coupons on check-in to the grill at the outdoor pool and for dinner at the Reflections restaurant. The hotel is on the beach, which is broad and clean with a lifeguard station right opposite the hotel. They also have a kids club where they do activities from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM and then they show kids movies from 7:00 PM. You need to sign-up for these at the front desk in advance. The hotel though dated in parts is clean and very functional. The staff is also very helpful. We had carried our DVD player but that could not be hooked up to the TV in the room, which however had a VCR attached to the TV. They also have VHS movies available at the front desk for free. There is a good grocery store about a block south of the hotel on the opposite side of the highway. In the same strip mall they also have a video store which sells VHS movies for $ 2.00. I had initially booked for three nights and prepaid the first night when I made my booking. Due to an urgent appointment on the third day, I had to check out a day earlier. The hotel charged me for the three nights, but they said if I could fax them documentation to show the nature of the urgency they would credit the third night back. The hotel kept its word. Once I faxed them some paperwork they credited the charges back. We really enjoyed our stay and will surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice time”
Reviews.Author: mobaer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a short weekend trip in August. We arrived on Friday at 1:00 and our room was ready. The room did smell pretty bad. I think it was the carpet which was very old. We had an East Oceanview room which was nice. We could see the beach directly and the pool. Besides the rug the room was worn but I thought clean. We decided to stay another night and they no longer had the same room. They upgraded us to a direct ocean view room for the same price. These rooms are all remodeled and much nicer. The set up was the same but the rug was clean and the appliances were new. I would book these rooms first off the next time. I understand they are remodeling the rooms a few at a time instead of a whole floor. The pool was small but they had a swim up bar which we used. Overall they were very accomodating. The location is great but they really need to redo all the rooms for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: poolhog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Holiday inn Oceanfront. I thought the hotel was clean, great service, and excellent location. Guests were mixed, young, middle aged & older. Great faciliities for the kids and adults. Also the hotel has one of the only 4 star restaurants on the island called reflections. A llitle pricey but good. Shuttle to take you to the boardwalk for $2 each, better than driving because of traffic & parking. you can't go wrong here for a hotel at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: LargeLadDad
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel isn't the newest property in the world, the room was nice; the view was wonderful. The hotel is L shaped, with one part of the L running parallel to the beach and the other perpendicular to it. Our room was a two bed efficiency on the seventh floor of this eight story property; we had a wonderful view of the beach and pool area. The pool area was nice, with a great bar, and a nice feature were the 8 to 10 hammocks the hotel provided next to the beach. The staff was friendly. There was plenty of parking, and a small grocery store directly across the Coastal highway. It's a Holiday Inn, not the Ritz, but my family and I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lajones63
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City. We loved the hotel! The front desk was extremely nice (very helpful in recommendations). Our room was exactly how we pictured it would be for a hotel room (clean and comfortable). Our favorite family fun was the pool and beach. The location of this hotel was perfect. We would absolutely come back to this hotel and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LuvASandyBeach
Reviews.Content: Pictures on website look much better than actual hotel & rooms. Hotel looks very dated and is in need of a complete makeover. Carpet was nasty & dirty and was always wet in front of dishwasher. Paid for oceanfront (was told I got an oceanfront) -- but I really got a 2nd floor garden view-- could see water (but not beach) if you looked between trees, tennis court & pool. Read the fine print. Not all rooms have dvd players, room dividers, fireplaces, or in-room safes. Kitchen utensils were sparse. Came back to room after it had been cleaned to find deadbolt on door set so door wouldn't close. Fortunately, nothing was taken. Inquired with management about security. Was told it was a very high priority & would be addressed. Next day, observed maids doing the same thing. Also, had to evacuate the building at 2:15 am, due to an emergency in the building. Although, it's not the Holiday Inn's fault, I didn't appreciate having to take 2 small children out of bed. On a positive side, "kids eat free" was nice and I liked the free fruit available all day in the lobby. This was my last stay at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DSXM
Reviews.Content: A group of six of us just spent 4 days/3 nights at this hotel. We got there before our room was supposed to be ready, but were allowed to check-in anyway. One of my friends is a platinum member and asked for an upgrade. The clerk upgraded us from a gardenview to an oceanview (which was nice...but no need to spend the extra money on oceanview in my opiniom). We got some coupons, discounts, and freebies upon checking-in as well. We were also given as many parking passes as we wanted! The room we booked had 2 beds, a fold-out, 1 bath, tv, balcony, and full kitchenette - as advertised. It was all in one long room rather than divided up, which was a little surprising, but not a big deal. We needed more bath linens and pillows for the 6 of us and the service at this hotel consistently proved to be great. They delivered anything we needed right away. Housekeeping was very tidy. The front desk was friendly and well-staffed. In terms of amenities, the hotel had just about everything - beach access, outdoor pool with multiple lounging areas, pool bar, outdoor bar and grill (open for lunch), shuffleboard, tennis court, video games, ice and vedning machines, indoor pool, exercise room, and more. There were also two restaurants near the lobby - an upscale "French/American" and a seafood/raw bar. We didn't eat in either of those so we can't comment. One of the restaurants also served the typical Holiday Inn breakfast (Since we had the suite, we bought our own breakfast fixings and ate in the room each morning). The outdoor bar and grill was good for lunch. The hotel could have used a more "pedestrian" restaurant open for all three meals, though there are no shortage of restaurants in Ocean City! It is across the street from a supermarket, restaurant, candy store, and surf shop, and you can catch the bus right there as well. In summary, the service was outstanding, the room was as advertised, and there were a good amount of amenties; I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: JTone_and_the_Mrs
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Holiday Inn Oceanfront and were very impressed. We were in the East Wing Oceanfront (I think that's what it was called) on the 7th floor, in the middle of the wing. If we were staying there again I think we would ask for a similar room, if not further down the wing toward the end. From our balcony we had a fabulous view of the ocean. Had we been lower we may have been somewhat obstructed by the trees and the outdoor pool area. We also had a great bayside view in the hallway outside our door. We opened the door one evening and watched the sun set while we made dinner. The Kitchenette was top notch! Had a dishwasher, oven, microwave, even an electric can opener and toaster. It came equiped with dishes, silverware and cook ware. We were set to be able to cook on our own. Very important for us, due to the fact that we have a child who has serious food allergies and we have to prepare ALL his food ourselves. The room was a nice size for a hotel room. There was an area with a pull out sofa and TV along with the bed area and kitchen area. It was very comfortable. The room was pretty clean, and I'm VERY picky. I've been in top notch hotels and some that well...once were top totch. I would recommend this hotel to someone looking for a clean, comfortable room. The arcade, indoor pool were a great plus. Our kids spent quite some time enjoying the pool. The arcade had a pool table that was quite some fun for our 8 year old. We ordered room service during our stay and it was very nice. Great service and timely. A nice treat! I would recommed this hotel. We live nearby and often are looking for good places to suggest to family and friends to stay. This one is on our list. (note...there are some VERY popular OC hotels that we WOULDN'T recommend!!!, so it's nice to find one that is a keeper.)

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Tori54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn on 66th street in September, 2006. Was very disappointed. The lobby is old and needs an update. My room smelled musty and felt wet and humid the entire time. The room is old and needs a make over, especially the carpet. The hallways are disgusting and smelled very bad. I could not wait until my vacation was over. The view was nice, but that was the only thing that was worthwhile. Alot of teenagers around the pool drinking. Not one was carded and most looked under age. Would never stay there again. One night a teenager was on the beach screaming for about a hour.

Reviews.Title: “I live this place”
Reviews.Author: sextonac
Reviews.Content: I love this placeI I stayed here when i was 16 and had tons of fond memories. Then this summer we stayed here again, this time with my husband at age 23. The place was better than I even remembered. Large rooms, fulls kitchens, large bathrooms, and wonderful views. Lots of extras inculded such as tanning beds, weight rooms, indoor and outdoor pool, 2 indoor spas. Once again i Love this Place and I will be back yearly. !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “66th Street Holiday Inn is pretty fine”
Reviews.Author: GolferWantToBe
Reviews.Content: Our family used to stay there, but since the kids have grown we have not been back in a while. Glad to see it has been updated nicely. Still has nice, functional rooms with mini kitchen, 2 beds, pull out sleeper sofa, small table and chairs. They have added a fake, but nicely cosmetic fire place. Nice view over pool of Ocean and beach. Nice balcony. Pool area very nice with swin up bar and nice grill and tables. They have added some hammocks overlooking pool on one side and beach on the other. A private oasis. Not glitzy or swank. But functional, clean and very nice. Small but useful indoor pool. They have upgraded the hot tubs to have a separate, private area. Game room for the kids. Far enough away from boardwalk to offer some quiet and less crowded beach and roads. But, close enough so you can get there easily if you want to. A little price, but that comes with a beachfront hotel. Only complaint was that for some reason they could not get our phones to work. I think that was an unusual situation. Enjoy. Good for the whole family, adults and kids

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Ocean City
HotelInfo.Address: 6600 Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD 21842
